loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ahmed's brother engagement party expenses

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom lives in Jaranwala which is a small city of Punjab Pakistan and known for agriculture industry. She has lived there with her family in a 4 room brick house for almost 35 years. She is a hardworking lady and operates a grocery store business in the community to supplement the income of her family. Through her store she sells daily use items like sugar, spices, cold drinks etc to the customers. She started this business 4 years ago and it is earning good profits for her now on monthly basis. 

Her husband’s name is Rehmat A. and he is unemployed. She is the mother of 6 sons. Her eldest son works abroad. The next youngest son operates a grocery store and 2 sons work in a factory for monthly wages. Her 2 youngest sons stay at home. 

Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her grocery store business. With the loan, she will buy groceries in bulk to meet the demand of her customers and to earn more income. Kalsoom is hopeful that a loan investment will help her business to grow and earn better profits. She is very hopeful that her family will have a secure future. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has paid her installments on time and never missed a single loan group meeting. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kalsoom”.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery store business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bamboo needed for chairs production

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a young man from Bethlehem.  Muhammad is married and had his first baby a few days ago. Muhammad is an employee with a decent salary. 

Muhammad's wife had complications during labor and delivery and needed an urgent surgery, Muhammad couldn't afford paying the cost at once therefor he took out a loan from FATEN to pay the hospital and repay FATEN later on monthly basis.

Muhammad appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: Muhammad's wife baby delivery expenses

loans.name: Irshaad's Group

texts.en:
Irshaad has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to financially assist her son in his agriculture business. He works in the fields and grows different seasonal crops. With this loan, he will purchase fertilizers and seeds, etc., which will help him grow crops and earn good income. Irshaad is hopeful that her son, who has been operating this business for the past five years, will get the desired results from his work with the loan investment. 

Irshaad is a very supportive lady. In order to financially assist her family, she sells milk. She has a buffalo at home whose milk she sells to clients in her community at a reasonable rate. Her buffalo produces 8-10 kg of milk per day and she sells 1 kg of milk at approximately 45 Pakistani rupees which is almost the same price in every city. Her earned income allows her to pay off the utilities and to manage the financial affairs of her family smoothly.

Irshaad has three other sons and three daughters. Her sons do different kinds of businesses and play their part for the financial survival of their family. Her daughters stay at home and help their mother in her daily works. Irshaad has been living in the city of Jaranwala for the past many years. Jaranwala is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agricultural industry. She lives with her family in a two-room brick house. 

Irshaad is a regular client of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Irshaad.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a wife and the mother of two daughters. She is studying and looking forward to continuing her education to earn a BA and start working. Eman needs this loan to pay for tuition fees and other education-related expenses. Eman took out a previous loan from FATEN and repaid it successfully and on time with the help of her husband, who is an employee.

Eman appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: For school tuition fees

loans.name: Hameeda's Group

texts.en:
Hameeda lives in Jaranwala, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agricultural industry. She has been living in a two-room brick house in Jaranwala with her family for more than 20 years. Hameeda is a housewife, preferring to stay at home and do household work. She has given birth to four daughters and two sons. Her eldest son has a welding business while the other stays at home. Her husband, M. A., operates a dairy business from home. He has a buffalo whose milk he sells to the community to earn an income. He has been in this business for the past five years. He has a good number of clients in his community, who buy milk from him due to its freshness and good quality. 

Hameeda has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s dairy business. With this loan, he will buy another buffalo which will increase his production of milk and increase his sales. She is a regular client of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Hameeda.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for a dairy business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase toys for resale

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is from the town of Banga. She is 35 years old, married and has three children aged 14, 11 and 3. To make a living, Analyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. She works hard to provide her family with food on the table, clothes to wear and other things they need.
Analyn joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase sacks of seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Khalida Shoqat Ali's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a wife of S. A. and lives in the Pakistani city of Kasur, famous for its tanneries industry. She owns a two-roomed house and lives in it with her family. A very caring lady, Khalida stays at home and manages her household work. She is also known in her community for her good hospitable nature. She feels happy to serve people.
Khalida's husband is also a very good-natured man. He is involved in a business selling sanitary supplies such as taps, water pipes etc. He also offers customers sanitary fitting services. He is a very experienced man who has been in this profession for many years. He has a shop in the market where people approach him to buy sanitary supplies and fit them at their houses.
Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy sanitary supplies such as taps, water pipes etc in larger quantities to sell in his shop. Khalida is hopeful that through the loan investment her husband’s business will be expanded and earn him maximum profits.
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Khalida.

loans.use: To buy sanitary supplies (such as taps and water pipes) for resale

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is from the town of Banga. She is 27 years old, married and has two young children. To make a living, Annie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Annie works hard to provide her family with a better standard of living.
Annie is in need of additional seed and fertilzer. She has applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her harvest.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en: Muhammad (pictured here) is a young man and university student in Bethlehem. His father is a Palestinian National Authority employee. Muhammad's father can't help Muhammad pay his tuition fees any more due to his insufficient salary. Muhammad thought of starting his own business to enable him to carry on with school and help his father in the near future. He took out a loan from Kiva partner, FATEN, to purchase equipment and start-up items for a small restaurant, which he could open next to the university where he studies. Muhammad's customers will be university students, and hopefully this business will secure him a steady income.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for restaurant

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos S. is from the town of Banga.  He is 47 years old.  Carlos is married.  To make a living, Carlos owns and operates a business raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale.  Carlos earns approximately 3,000 PHP from rice farming.

Carlos joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Carlos has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Carlos is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Demna

texts.en:
48-year-old Demna Y. is from the town of Banga.  She is married.  To make a living, Demna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale.  Demna said she wants to be a good mother to her kids and also a good neighbor.

Demna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Demna has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  Demna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, chemicals and fertilizers.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, chemicals and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 35-year-old man from Jericho. He is a paraplegic and uses a wheelchair. Ali was a DJ before having the accident that paused his life for a while, and now that he is more adapted he wants to go back to his old profession. Ali took a loan from Kiva partner, FATEN, to purchase the DJ equipment he needs. Ali is known in Jericho as one of the best DJs in the city. He appears in the picture in his car in front of FATEN's office.

loans.use: To purchase DJ equipment

loans.name: Margarette Khursheed Younas Masih's Group

texts.en:
Margarette Khursheed is a wife of Y. M. and lives in the Pakistani city of Kasur, which is famous for its sweetmeats. She owns a single-roomed brick house there and lives in it with her family. A caring lady, Margarette stays at home and carried out her responsibilities as a housewife well. She gets up early in the morning and prepares breakfast for her family and then cleans up the whole house. Her family feels happy and respects her for her attention and love for them.
Margarette's husband operates a business selling eggs. He operates a shop in the market where he specifically deals with eggs and earns income for the family. Previously, he sold the eggs from his home and at that time his customer base was local community members. But later he opened a shop in the market and started selling to many more people.
Margarette has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy eggs in bulk to put in his shop to increase his sales. Margarette is hopeful that the loan investment will take her husband’s business into a more profitable position. Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Margarette Khursheed.

loans.use: To buy eggs for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for hospital expenses

loans.name: Fazilat Bibi

texts.en:
Fazilat bibi is a resident of Kasur, located in Punjab, Pakistan, and known for its sweetmeats. She owns a two-room brick house there and lives in it with her family. 

A hardworking lady, Fazilat owns and operates a sewing business at her home. She does this work to supplement the income of her family. She is good at her work and receives orders from neighboring areas. She learned this art at her mother’s home and is now benefitting from it.  She charges $1.42 for a simple dress and $2.14 for a designer dress. Her customers don’t argue with her on rates because of her good quality work.
 
Her husband's name is A. R. and he is a butcher by profession. He operates a shop in the market where he sells chicken meat exclusively to the customers. People at the market know him for his good behavior and the quality of his meat. 

Fazilat has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy chickens in larger quantities to increase his sales and to earn maximum profits. Fazilat is hopeful that through the loan investment her husband will be able to fill the larger orders of his customers on time and make his business more profitable.

loans.use: To buy chickens for her husband's meat-selling business

loans.name: Razia Begum's Group

texts.en:
Razia begum is the wife of S. D. and belongs to the small city of Kasur in Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its tannery industry. She owns a two-room house there and lives in it with her family. 

She and her husband are involved in a clothing business. Her husband goes to Lahore and Faisalabad for purchasing clothes. Razia sells clothes to her community people and S. operates a clothing shop in the market. They are well known for their business. They get good orders from their customers and earn well by fulfilling them. They keep themselves up to date about the latest trends in fashion and easily understand the customers' demands. Their earnings help them to manage their finances smoothly. 

Besides the clothing business, Razia also manages her household work efficiently.  

She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her family business. With the loan, her husband will buy clothes of different varieties in bulk quantities. The bulk purchasing will decrease the traveling costs and increase their business sales. They are hopeful that their business will be improved further after making this investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia begum.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Naheel

texts.en:
Naheel is a young woman from Hebron. She is married and has no children. Naheel's husband is a taxi driver, making $400 a month. Naheel wants to start her own project. She has a small amount of money, and she took out a loan from FATEN to pay for purchasing goats.

Naheel will start the farm on a small piece of land in the backyard of her house, raising goats and selling their milk to clients in Hebron.

Naheel and her father-in-law appear in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Hebron.

loans.use: To purchase goats to raise on her farm

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is a young woman from Qalqilia. She has been working in sewing for a long time, and she was able to save a fair amount of money to start a small business. Hana will rent a shop to open a grocery store.

Hana took out a loan from FATEN to purchase display shelves and stands for the items she will be selling in the store. She also owns a house which she rents out for $70 a month.

Hana is photographed in FATEN's office in their Qalqilia branch.

loans.use: To purchase display stands and shelves for her store.

loans.name: Kishwar Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Kishwar tahira is a resident of the small city of Kasur in Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its tannery industry. She owns a two-room house there and lives in it with her family. 

Her husband's name is S. A., and he is involved in a clothing business. He sells clothes through a shop located in the market. He sells specifically ladies' clothes there and manages a good clientele base. Kishwar helps him by selling clothes to ladies in her community. Their good collection of clothes has made them renowned among their customers. Kishwar is an active lady, and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife well and takes care of her family.
 
She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy clothing of different varieties in bulk quantities. The bulk purchasing will enable him to offer more variety to his customers and will increase his sales. Kishwar is confident that through the loan investment her husband’s business will become more profitable. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kishwar tahira.

loans.use: To buy clothes for a clothing business

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a young man from Gaza, who has recently become employed. Mahmoud's father couldn't afford to pay the electricity bill as he has a big family and many concerns to take care of. Now that Mahmoud is employed, he took out a loan from FATEN to pay the bills and repay FATEN on a monthly basis.

Mahmoud appears in the picture here in FATEN's branch

loans.use: For electricity bill

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two grown daughters. She is a farmer from Kamenka, which is a predominantly agricultural region of Ukraine. Ludmila grows early spring vegetables for sale in her region as well as other regions of Ukraine. She owns four big greenhouses, ten smaller ones for cabbage, and two more separate ones for seedlings. Ludmila has been in this farming business for 22 years. She has already invested about 60,000 grivnyas in this enterprise. Her annual expenses for seeds and film amount to a total of 30,000 grivnyas.  

Ludmila is requesting a loan of 15,000 grivnyas to fix one of the greenhouses and purchase seeds, fertilizers and polyethylene film. Ludmila is very energetic. She never stops and always moves forward aiming at new horizons and pursuing new accomplishments. She is hoping to construct an additional greenhouse some time this year. Moreover, in addition to her farming business, Ludmila raises chicken broilers and 30 minks for the purpose of getting their skins and selling their expensive fur.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and polyethylene film

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is 47 years old and has given birth to three sons and a daughter. They live in a small city called KasU., which is located in Punjab, Pakistan, and is famous for its leather industry. Her elder son has a transport business and her daughter is a school teacher. Her other children are getting their education by going to school. She is married to M. Y. who operates a grocery store in the market. He sells daily use items like oil, sugar, spices, rice, etc. He is known among his clients for his fair dealing and the quality of his products.

Safia also supports her family selling thread. She supplies thread at reasonable rates to different thread sellers at the markets. She is also a very good mother and wife. She performs her household responsibilities very well. 

Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to help her husband expand his grocery store business. With this loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to put in his store to sell. Safia is hopeful that through the loan investment her husband will be able to increase his income and make his business more profitable. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.  

In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Safia.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery store business

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is divorced with a grown daughter, Victoria. She lives in Melitopol. Ludmila runs a clothing venture selling women’s outer wear items in the central marketplace. She owns a well-equipped vending kiosk which is convenient for potential customers who stop by to try something on and buy from her.  

Ludmila started her business 12 years ago. It has grown up to a size of 45,000 Grivnyas in inventory and 17,000 Grivnyas in gross income. Her net profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas a month. Ludmila is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional clothing items at a wholesale price and re-sell them at retail, thus generating additional profit as a result. She is hoping to continue growing her trade and to assist her daughter financially whenever she can.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with a grown daughter, Yulya. She sells groceries in one of the markets of Melitopol where she lives with her family. Svetlana is an experienced entrepreneur. She has been working in the sphere of market vending for 13 years. Presently, she has about 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her net profit amounts to 4,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Svetlana is seeking a 10,000 Grivnya loan to increase assorted merchandise she offers for sale at her vending kiosk. She is hoping to continue expanding her trade and support her family, as well as her elderly parents who can barely survive on their retirement fees and are financially dependent on her. Svetlana believes additional merchandise will help her generate additional income and ensure better living conditions for her entire family as a result.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima is a talented lady who sells clothing and also does embroidery work for her neighborhood clients to help support her family financially. She has three children. Two of them attend school, while her youngest one is only 3 years old and has not started attending school yet.  

She is a resident of Jamatpura, which is a small housing colony in Kasur. Kasur is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan and is known for its leather industry. She came here after her marriage. 

Her husband’s name is M. A., who is a rickshaw driver by profession. He offers his transportation services to both adult passengers and school children. He adopted this profession three years ago. 

Saima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothing business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk quantity which will help her to offer more variety to her customers and earn a good profit.  

She is a new loan user of Asasah and she is hopeful that this will earn her good profits so she will become a regular user. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raising hand is Saima”.

loans.use: To buy clothing for her business

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a young man from Hebron.  He inherited a small piece of land from his father and he started farming it to make a living. He plants seasonal vegetables and raises birds to sell. He also buys old furniture, fixes it, paints it and resells it.

Muhammad came to FATEN and took out a loan to purchase fertilizers and farming tools to replace the old ones he uses now. This loan will help him increase his returns and the number of customers.

Muhammad appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and farming tools

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran belongs to Kasur, which is a small city of Pakistan known for its leather industry. She lives there in the area of Bhasarpura with her family in a three-room brick house. She is 49 years old and has seven children.

Her elder son has a shoe manufacturing business and all of his siblings help him in completing his orders to financially contribute to the family. They are all illiterate and couldn’t get an education due to financial constraints. As a result they couldn’t find jobs. 

Her husband is involved in a paranda-making business (an ornament used to tie-back hair). It is in high demand in the local market and he earns a good income from his profession. 

Nazeeran is also a very talented lady. She operates an embroidery business at her home. She offers her services to her community ladies for a reasonable amount and gets good orders from them every month. 
 
She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her son’s shoe manufacturing business. He will utilize the loan for the purchasing of raw material, like leather, nails, glue, etc. to manufacture more shoes for selling. He has been operating this business since he was a teenager and has vast experience in this field. Nazeeran is hopeful that an investment will take her son’s business to a more profitable position and that he will be able to make more money by fulfilling orders on time. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.

loans.use: To buy leather, nails and glue for shoe manufacturing business

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina lives in a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, called Kasur, which is famous for its tanneries industry. She has been living there in a three-room brick house with her family for the past seven years. She is 47 years old, married to G. H., and has four sons. Her three elder sons left their education and started an embroidery business, while her youngest son is 15 years old and stays at home. He is illiterate.  

Her husband operates a public call office through which he offers nationwide and long distance calls to his customers. Sakina supports her family by doing embroidery work. She takes orders from her community and fills them on time to earn an income. The income helps her manage her household expenses and to save for her son’s marriage.  

She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her elder son who wants to buy an embroidery machine for his embroidery business, which will help him finish orders in less time and make extra income. Sakina is hopeful that he will successfully be able to improve the financial condition of his business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat lives in Kasur, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, and is known for its leather industry. She lives there in a small two-room home in the area of Rukn-pura. She is the mother of three sons. All of them are very young and studying in the local school. Farhat herself is a 35-year-old talented lady who operates a clothes sewing business at her home. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients and generates income for the family.
 
Her husband's name is M. S. and he has an electronics sales shop. He sells different electronics such as televisions, irons, etc. on installments. He buys products from wholesale markets and then offers the opportunity to his clients to buy those products on installments with interest. He has been operating this business for over eighteen years. 

Farhat has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more items to sell to his clients for profit.  Farhat is very confident that her husband’s business will be improved and that her family's standard of living will become better as a result. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior by paying her installments on time and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy items like televisions and irons for her husband's business

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia lives in a small city called Kasur, which is located in Pakistan and known for its leather industry. She is 37 years old and lives with her family in a two-room brick house in the area named Basti wanikaan. She supports her family financially by making paranday (an ornament used to tie back hair). She sells them to different cosmetics shops to earn an income. She is the mother of six children, three sons and three daughters. Only her second daughter, who is 7 years old, is managing to get an education by attending school. 

Safia's husband, whose name is M. S., is involved in a shoe-soles stitching business. He makes contracts with different shoe making factories and fills their orders to earn an income. His business is well established and he has been operating this business for the past twenty-five years. Her three sons and eldest daughter also help their father in his business, by stitching shoe soles. 

Safia has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy needles and thread in bulk quantities, which will help him fill larger orders and make more income. Safia is sure that her husband will definitely be able to expand his business with the help of an investment. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy needles and thread for her husband's shoe-sole stitching business

loans.name: Unidos Para Vencer 3 Group

texts.en:
Fiordaliza is the coordinator of her group “Unidos para Vencer 3” (United to Win 3). She lives in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. She says that her dream is to have her own house. In the meantime, she enjoys studying. Fiordaliza is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza. She successfully repaid her previous loan that she used to start her business selling shoes. She will use her current loan to buy more shoes to sell.

Fiordaliza joined Esperanza because she wanted to improve her life and have a business. Her story is representative of her fellow group members and of Esperanza’s Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Fiordaliza’s group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, and the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water—none of which is potable.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Kosar Bibi

texts.en:
Kosar Bibi lives in a small city named Kasur in Pakistan that is famous for its sweetmeat industry. Kosar is 38 years old and owns a two-room house where she lives with her family. Due to her poor financial condition, she was not able to attend school. Kosar has a dairy business and she keeps buffaloes at home from which she gets milk to sell in the community. Her work supplements her family’s income.

Kosar’s husband is M. Y. and he is a butcher. He runs a shop in the market where he sells chicken meat and earns income for the family. He has a reputation among his customers for fresh and good quality meat.  Kosar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, they will buy chickens in large quantity to sell for profit. 

Kosar is hopeful that her loan investment will bring positive financial change to her husband’s business as well as improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chickens for butcher shop

loans.name: Victoria Adelante 2 Group

texts.en:
Felicia is the coordinator of her group Victoria Adelante 2 (Victory Ahead 2). She is a young mother with a child and she lives in a simple structure with her long-term partner. Her dream is to have more children and have a successful family. She enjoys cooking and studying.

Felicia is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza. She successfully repaid her first loan that was used to expand her clothing business. She started her business with her own savings and has been running it for almost two years. Felicia plans to use this loan to purchase a variety of sizes and types of clothing for men, women, and children.  

Felicia joined Esperanza to get capital to improve her business. Her story is representative of her fellow group members and of Esperanza’s Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Felicia’s group is located in a rural area of San Pedro de Macoris, surrounded by sugar cane fields. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water—none of which is potable.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Rubina Sadar Ali's Group

texts.en:
Rubina lives in Arifwala, a city in Pakistan famous for its agricultural business. She owns a two-room house in an area named Zia nagar where she lives with her family. Rubina is a talented lady who runs a sewing and tailoring business from her home. She sews clothes for neighborhood customers and her work supplements the family’s income. She is expert in her work and can easily sew designer and non-designer dresses. Her customers are very satisfied with her work and choose her over others. 

Rubina’s husband is S. A.. He is involved in a business selling spare motorbike parts. S. operates a shop in the market where he sells reasonably priced spare parts to generate income. Rubina has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy spare motorcycle parts to sell. 

Rubina is the woman in the photo holding the Asasah Passbook. She is hopeful that this loan will help expand her husband’s business and increase his profit.

loans.use: to buy spare motorcycle parts

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen is the wife of S. A. and lives in a city called Arifwala in Pakistan. Arifwala is known for its agriculture industry. She owns a two-room house there and lives with her family in the area Zia Nagar. 

A very caring lady, Shaheen carries out her responsibilities as a housewife by staying at home. She takes care of her family and fulfills all of their requirements. She makes the utmost effort to keep her family happy and her family respects her a lot for her good nature and feelings towards them. Her husband works in the transportation business. He has a vehicle named Shahzore which he uses to deliver items from one place to another. He has been in this business for many years and he has a good reputation for his work among his clients. 

Shaheen has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy tires for his conveyance because his old tires have become rough and need replacement. Shaheen is hopeful that through this investment her husband will be able to continue his transportation business and provide good service to his clients.

loans.use: To buy new tires to improve her husband's transportation business

loans.name: Arshan's Group

texts.en:
Arshan is the wife of S. and she lives in a city called Arifwala in Pakistan. Arifwala is known for its agriculture industry. Arshan is a very caring lady. Despite her old age, she is still very active and operates a sewing business in her home. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients and earns income for her family. She has been doing this work for many years and is well known in her region. She used to do this work on a part-time basis, but she has since started working full-time and has become the earning hand for her family. 

Besides her sewing business, she also manages her household chores very well. She keeps her family happy through her good behavior and helps them to solve their problems. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to improve her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine has become old and takes much time to sew a single dress. Arshan is hopeful that through this investment she will take her business to a more profitable position. 

Note: In the photo, Arshan is the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran is the wife of M. H. and she lives in a city called Arifwala in Pakistan. Arifwala is known for its agriculture industry. She owns a two-room house and lives with her family in the area Zia Nagar. A very active and talented lady, Manzooran operates an embroidery business in her home. Despite her old age, she does this work to support her family financially. She enjoys doing her work. She crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes. Many girls in the community come to her to learn her embroidery skills as well which gives her excitement and happiness. 
 
Her husband is in the business of selling sanitary supplies. He runs a shop in the market where he sells sanitary supplies such as taps, water pipes, etc. to his customers for a profit. He also knows sanitary fitting services which he offers to his clients. Both of them are very hardworking and manage their businesses well. They want to set a good legacy for their children so they feel proud of them. 

Manzooran has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a larger quantity of sanitary supplies to put in his shop for sale. She is hopeful that this investment will take her husband's business to a more profitable position.
 
Note: In the photo, Manzooran is the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy more sanitary supplies for sale

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is the wife of A. A. and she lives in a city called Arifwala in Pakistan. Arifwala is known for its agriculture industry. She owns a two-room house and lives with her family in the area named Zia Nagar. A very talented lady, Rubina operates a sewing business in her home. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients and earns income. She has been in this business for many years and is well-known in her region. She charges PKRs 120 for simple dress and PKRs 180 for designer dress and her customers don’t argue with her on charges because they admire her work. 
  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to expand her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy clothes and thread in bulk which she will sew according to the new designs and latest fashions that she will introduce to her customers. This investment will give her better opportunities to earn a profit and she will be able to introduce her talent to many more customers as well. She is hopeful that the idea will bring positive financial changes for her business and she will be able to earn more profit. 

Note: In the photo, Rubina is the lady with a book (called the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy more clothes and thread for expanding a sewing business

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is the wife of T. D. and she lives in a city called Okara in Pakistan. She owns a two-room house there and lives with her family in the area named Sheikh Basti. Zarina is 40 years old, a very caring mother and a wife. She manages her responsibilities very well by staying at home. She makes the utmost effort to provide ease to her family. She is fond of cooking and cooks delicious and healthy food for her family. 

Her husband is involved in a construction supplies selling business. He runs a shop in the market where he offers construction supplies like cement, bricks, sand, etc. to his customers. He mainly receives orders from the building constructors and earns good income by fulfilling them on time. He has been in this business for many years and is known among his clients for his quality products. 

Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies in bulk to put in his shop for selling. Zarina is hopeful that her husband’s financial condition will be improved after making this investment in his business. 

Note: In the photo, Zarina is the lady with a book (called the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy more supplies for a construction supplies selling business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with one child. He has a greenhouse business where he grows tomatoes and cucumbers. Alexander has been in this business for 8 years. He enjoys working with the land and providing people with high quality vegetables. Alexander keeps his greenhouses and his household in order. He fixes things himself when they break. His wife, Irina, helps Alexander in this business as well. 

Alexander has three greenhouses and he would like to develop his business further. He would like to borrow 10,000 Hryvnias to build an additional greenhouse. He hopes to grow more vegetables this year and increase income for his family.

loans.use: To build a new greenhouse

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina R. M. tiene la edad de 40 años, solo estudio primaria y esta casada con el señor Aurelio Mora con el cual tiene 2 hijas de nombres Alma Rosa que tienen 17 y estudia la preparatoria en el CBTa  y Estefania de 15 años de edad que asiste a la secundaria de su comunidad. Doña Catalina y su familia viven en la colonia Jalapilla en la comunidad de Acatlan de Perez Figueroa en el estado de Oaxaca.
Doña Cata como la llaman sus amigos y vecinos nos platica que desde hace mas de 3 años se dedica a criar y vender cochinos. Ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio porque quiere ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus pequeñas hijas y así  tengan un mejor calidad de vida.
Doña Cata nos platica que cuando inicio su negocio no tenia muchos recursos económicos y solo compro un pequeño cerdo el cual metió en su viejo chiquero(corral) lo alimento por algunos meses y después lo vendió con el dinero de su venta pudo comprar dos cerdos mas y así ha estado trabajando para que su negocio cresca. Ella necesita este préstamo para comprar mas cerdos, alimento y también desea comprar un par de borregos para iniciar a criar borregos, doña cata espera que su negocio cresca día a día un poco mas pero también sabe que la única manera de lograrlo es trabajar duro, ella desea que sus hijas sigan estudiando y quiere reparar su viejo chiquero ya que esta muy dañado. Ella también nos dice que se encuentra muy agradecida con la Fundación ya que con este préstamo podrá comprar sus cerdos y hacer que su negocio prospere día a día y poder pagar los estudios de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Catalina R. M. is 40 years old, completed elementary school, and is married to Aurelio Mora with whom she has 2 daughters named Alma Rosa, 17 years old and studies in the CBT preparatory school, and Stephanie, 15 years old and studies in the community’s secondary school. Catalina and her family live in Jalapilla neighborhood of Acatlan de Perez Figueroa in Oaxaca state.

Cata, as her friends and neighbors call her, tells us that she has been raising and selling pigs for more than 3 years. She decided to start her own business because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses, school expenses for her daughters, and to have a better quality of life.

Cata tells us when she began her business she didn’t have much money and she bought only a small pig which she put in an old corral, fed it for a few months, and then sold it. With the money from the sale she was able to buy two more pigs and she has been working to grown her business. She needs this loan to buy more pigs, feed, and also she wishes to buy a pair of sheep to begin raising sheep. Cata hopes that her business grows a little every day but she also knows the only way to achieve this is to work hard. She wishes that her daughters continue studying and she wants to repair their old pig pen which is very damaged. She also tells us that she is grateful to the Foundation because with this loan she will be able to buy her pigs and make her business prosper day after day and be able to pay for her daughters’ education.

loans.use: Raise and sell pigs.

loans.name: Fedor

texts.en:
Fedor is married with two small daughters. He runs a greenhouse business growing and selling tomatoes, cucumbers and other vegetables. Fedor has been in this business for 17 years. He is a very hardworking and disciplined person.

Fedor purchased a vehicle and now he needs some additional capital for his greenhouses. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 Hryvnias to install heating systems in his three greenhouses. These heating systems will allow him to harvest earlier and earn more income.

loans.use: To install heating systems in his three greenhouses

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya D. is married and has a grow son, Yevgenyi. Natalya owns two big spacious greenhouses and grows vegetables for sale at the market. She has been in farming for nine years. Currently, Natalya has 40,000 UAH invested in this project. She spends about 15,000 UAH on seeds and clear polyethylene film every year. 

This year she is building a new green house, which will increase the amount of produce offered for sale. Natalya is willing to work very hard to see her plans fulfilled. Natalya is seeking a 12,000 UAH loan to purchase supplies for her greenhouses.

One of her personal goals is to generate enough income to build a small shop that will enable their son to start working and generate income. 

Note: In the photo, Natalya is with her husband, a retired policeman.

loans.use: To purchase greenhouse supplies

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
La señora Eva E. R. vive en la comunidad de Aserradero a 10 minutos del municipio de Acatlan de Perez Figueroa en el estado de Oaxaca, ella tiene la edad de 37 años y es madre soltera de un niño de nombre Diego de 15 años de  edad que asiste a la escuela secundaria de Acatlan. Doña Eva nos platica que ella inicio trabajando fuera de casa de dependienta pero un día inicio a vender ropa interior por catalogo y se dio cuenta de que ganaba mas y tenia mas tiempo para estar a lado de su hijo y educarlo, ella tiene ya mas de 2 años vendiendo ropa interior, nos comenta que ella vende casa por casa, lleva los catálogos a sus clientes, levanta pedido lo encarga a sus proveedores y posteriormente cuando le llega el pedido lo entrega  y recibe el pago por sus productos, ella vende en su comunidad y también sale a otros pueblos como Cosolapa, Tezonapa, Refugio y Motzorongo. Ella nos dice que decidió iniciar  a trabajar ya que es madre soltera y tenia que vestir, calzar y alimentar a su hijo,  doña Eva también tiene un pequeño corral en la parte de atrás de su casa en donde tiene unos borregos los cuales cría y después vende, ella necesita este crédito  para invertirlo en la compra de catálogos, ropa interior y alimento para sus borregos. Doña Eva espera que con este préstamo su negocio prospere y con sus ganancias poder vender sabanas y colchas. ella quiere seguir trabajando ya que quiere que su hijo en un futuro tenga una profesión.
Doña eva se encuentra agradecida con la fundación por la oportunidad que le esta dando con este préstamo de que su negocio prospere y por la confianza que le a brindado al otorgarle este  préstamo.
texts.en:
Ms. Eva E. R. lives in the community of Aserradero, which is 10 minutes away from the city of Acatlan de Perez Figueroa in the state of Oaxaca. She is 37 years old and is a single mother with one son named Diego, who is 15 years old. He goes to high school in Acatlan. Eva says that she started working outside the home as a shop assistant, but one day she began to sell underclothes by catalog. She realized that she was making more money and had more time to be with her son and to educate him. She has already been selling underclothes for more than two years. She goes door to door selling clothes, bringing the catalogs to her customers. She brings the orders to her suppliers and later when the orders arrive, she delivers them to her customers and receives the payments for her products. She sells in her community and also goes to other towns such as Cosolapa, Tezonapa, Refugio and Motzorongo. She decided to start working because she is a single mother and she has to feed and clothe her son.

Ms. Eva also has a small corral behind her house where she keeps lambs that she raises and later sells. She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of catalogs, underclothes and because she wants to continue working so that her son can be an educated professional in the future. Eva is very grateful to the foundation for the opportunity that it has given her, so that her business can prosper and also for the trust they have shown in her by granting her this loan.

loans.use: The sale of catalog clothing and raising lambs.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es:
La señora Roberta S. R. tiene la edad de 34 años, ella solo inicio a estudiar la preparatoria perro no la termino por fata de recursos económicos, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de los cuales tres son mujer de nombres Alma Karina de 17 años de edad que estudia la preparatoria , Daniela de 11 años de edad y Maria de Jesus de 7 años que asisten a la primaria y un hombre de nombre Casiano de 13 años que asiste a la secundaria de su comunidad, ellos viven en la Colonia Jalapilla en la comunidad de Acatlan de Perez Figueroa en el estado de Oaxaca.

Doña Roberta nos platica que ella trabaja en una casa de cocinera y por las tardes y en sus tiempos libres elabora manualidades las cuales vende con sus amigas y vecinos, ella decidió iniciar a trabajar porque es madre soltera y tenia que buscar la manera de salir adelante con sus hijos, pero como lo que gana es muy poco inicio a vender manualidades para tener mas recursos económicos. ella nos platica que elabora tapetes para baño, servilletas bordadas, arreglos para fiestas y también hace pinturas en manta y cristal con las cuales elabora recuerdos, porta retratos y bolsas para dama, ella necesita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pinturas, manta, telas, listones, hilos, brochas, agujas y encajes para elaborar sus manualidades. Ella espera que este préstamo le de la oportunidad de que su negocio cresca. Doña Roberta desea que sus productos sean conocidos por mas personas para tener mas venta y que sus ganancias aumenten. Ella se encuentra agradecida con la Fundación por la confianza que le esta otorgando al brindarle este crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Roberta Sánchez R. is 34 years old.  She started high school but did not finish due to lack of economic resources.  She is a single mother of four children: three girls, Alma Karina, 17 who is in high school, Daniela, 11 and María de Jesús, 7, who are in elementary school, and one boy, Casiano, 13, who is in the local middle school.  They live in the Jalapilla neighborhood in Acatlan de Pérez Figueroa in the state of Oaxaca.

Roberta tells us that she works as a cook in a private home and during the afternoons and in her free time she makes crafts that she sells among her friends and neighbors.  She decided to start working because she’s a single mother and had to find the way to support her children.  Because her salary is low she started selling crafts to earn extra income.  She relates that she makes bath mats, embroidered napkins, and party decorations.  She also paints pictures on cloth and makes crystal keepsakes, picture frames and women’s purses.

She needs this financing to invest in paints, cloths, fabric, ribbon, thread, brushes, needles and lace to make the crafts.  She hopes the loan will provide her with the opportunity for her business to grow.
‘
Roberta hopes that her products will be known by more people in order to have higher sales and that her profits increase.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the trust placed in her by granting this loan.

loans.use: For arts and crafts sales.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana E. R. tiene la edad de 50 años, estudio hasta segundo grado de primaria y es madre soltera de dos hijo de los cuales uno es hombre de nombre Joel de nueve años de edad que asiste a la primaria y una mujer de 37 años de nombre Eva, doña Juana y su familia viven en la comunidad de Aserradero a 10 minutos del municipio de Acatlan de Perez Figueroa en el estado de Oaxaca.

Doña Juana nos platica que desde hace años   trabaja en la cría de borregos, nos dice que inicio con 2 borregos y  poco a poco a comprado mas borregos con las ganancias que a obtenido, Doña Juana tienen un pequeño corral en la parte de atrás de su casa y alimenta a sus borregos con alimento y todos los días los saca a pastorear para que también coman un poco de hierbas. Ella decidió iniciar  con su propio negocio ya que es madre soltera y necesitaba sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella nos dice que otro de los motivos por los cuales inicio con la cría de borregos es porque se gana mas dinero con la venta de sus animales que trabajando de dependienta en una tienda y puede dedicarle mas tiempo al pequeño Joel, doña Juana también vende barbacoa y consome de borrego los domingos, ella vende la barbacoa desde su casa, levanta pedidos y cuando termina de preparar su barbacoa entrega sus pedidos, también nos dice que como ya sus clientes saben que vende sin necesidad de ofrecer llegan a buscar la barbacoa a su casa. Doña Juana espera que en un futuro su negocio siga creciendo y tener mas clientes para que sus ganancias aumenten y poder construir un pequeño local el cual lo acondicionara para que sus clientes vallan a comer su barbacoa. 

Doña Juana se encuentra agradecida con la fundación por la oportunidad que le esta dando para que su negocio cresca al otorgarle este préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana E. R. is 50 years old and studied up to the second year of elementary school.  She is a single mother and has two children: a 9 year-old son Joel, who is in elementary school, and a 37 year-old daughter called Eva.  Juana and her family live in Aserradero neighborhood, 10 minutes from the town of Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, in the State of Oaxaca.

Juana tells us that she has been raising lambs for years.  She tells us that she started out with 2 lambs and has gradually been buying more with the profits that she has made.  Juana has a small pen behind her home where she feeds her lambs.  She also takes them out to graze every day so that they get to eat a bit of grass.  Juana decided to set up her own business since she is a single mother and she needed to get her children ahead in life.  She tells us that a further motive for starting out in her lamb-raising business was that there was more money to be earned in selling her animals than there was in her job as a sales assistant in a store.  This work also means she is able to spend more time with her young son Joel.

In addition to raising her lambs, Juana also sells barbecued lamb and lamb consommé on Sundays.  She sells the barbecued meat from her home.  She prepares orders which she then delivers.  She also tells us that her customers come to her home.  Juana hopes that, in the future, her business will continue to grow and that she will attract more customers so that her profits rise and she will be able to build a small business premises which she will adapt so that her customers can stay and eat her barbecued meat.

Juana is grateful to the foundation for providing this loan as it will give her the opportunity to help her business grow.

loans.use: To raise and sell lamb and to sell barbecued meat

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es: La señora Verónica H. E. tiene la edad de 32 años, estudia Licenciatura en Pedagogía en la universidad  de la Zona Urbana (UPN) y actualmente se encuentra viviendo en unión libre con el señor Santiago Ruiz con el que tiene un hijo de nombre Juan Diego de 5 años de edad que asiste al preescolar. La señora Verónica y su familia viven en la comunidad de Aserradero que pertenece al municipio de Acatlan de Perez Figueroa en el estado de Oaxaca. Doña Vero como la conocen en su comunidad desde hace algunos años siembra caña la cual vende al ingenio azucarero, cría ganado (vacas) y tiene un carro de carga el cual alquila en tiempo de zafra(cuando los ingenios inician su producción) para acarrear caña. Ella decidió iniciar a trabajar ya que deseaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y terminar su carrera, Doña vero nos dice que  cuando mejor le va en sus negocios es en tiempo de zafra ya que es cuando le cortan su caña y renta su carro, ella necesita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes, abono, alimento, llantas y aceite. Doña vero desea que su negocio cresca y le deje buenas ganancias ya que desea que su pequeño hijo estudie una carrera y ayudarlo a forjar un patrimonio, también nos dijo que se encuentra agradecida con la fundación por la confianza que le ha brindado al otorgarle este préstamo el cual ayudara a que su negocio prospere.
texts.en: Verónica H. E., 32, is studying to be a teacher at the Zona Urbana University (UPN).  She lives in a common-law marriage with Santiago Ruiz and they have a 5 year old son, Juan Diego, who is in pre-kindergarten.  Verónica and her family live in the community of Aserradero, that is part of the Acatlan de Perez Figueroa municipality in the state of Oaxaca.  Vero, as she has been called for many years, grows sugar cane that she sells to a sugar refinery.  She raises cattle (cows) and she has a truck that she rents out during the sugar harvest season (the time when the refineries begin their production) to transport the cane.  She decided to work now because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses, giving her son a better quality of life, and to finish her studies.  Vero tells us that the times that her business does well are in the harvest season when they cut the cane, and she rents out  the truck.  She needs the loan to buy fertilizer, manure, plant food, tires and oil.  Vero wants to see her business grow so that it will give her profits.  She will use the earnings for her small son so that he can  study a career and to help strengthen his patrimony.   She tells us that she is grateful for the confidence that the foundation has shown her by offering the loan that will help her business proper.

loans.use: Growing sugar cane, cattle, and a pickup truck

loans.name: Sartawi Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal Sartawi está ingresando al ciclo Nro. 7, es parte del centro focal de Los Andes, ya tiene experiencia como banca comunal y por lo tanto se sienten seguras de que las integrantes son personas de confianza.  Está integrado por diez personas  9 mujeres y 1  varón.
Los negocios son diferentes, de servicio, producción o comercio, entre ellos tenemos: panadería, producción de bolsas, producción de tullmas (adornos para trenzar el cabello)taller mecánico, comercio, venta de calzados, tienda, tienda surtida, taller de costura, artesanía  muñequería y títeres.
La Banca Comunal de Sartawi está dirigida por una mesa directiva compuesta por la presidenta,la tesorera y la secretaria de actas.                  .
La  presidenta, la señora Sabina ha participado  tres ciclos en su grupo, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  Con el tiempo ha desarrollado dos negocios, por un lado es artesana teje ropa en miniatura, animalitos, elabora cuadros de paisajes andinos con en lanas naturales y por otro lado ella tiene un pequeña tienda de barrio en su domicilio.  El crédito que está solicitando le servirá para ampliar la tienda y vender carne, y tambien comprar lana de alpaca por cono.  Ella indica que debido a que utiliza lana de alpaca es mejor comprar por mayor para lograr ganancias.
Cuando se le consulta por que está en Pro Mujer ella responde que por las amigas,  por el ahorro y la opción de trabajar con la caja chica.
texts.en:
The Sartawi communal bank is starting cycle #7.  It is part of the Los Andes focal center.  It has prior communal bank experience so they feel sure that the members are trustworthy people.  It has 10 members, nine women and one man.

The businesses are different: service, production or commerce.  Among them we find: bakery, bag production, tullmas (hair braiding decorations) production, machine shop, shoe sales, store, stocked store, sewing workshop, doll and puppet making crafts.

The Sartawi communal bank is led by a Board of Directors comprised of a President, Treasurer and Recording Secretary.

The President, Sabina, has participated in three group cycles.  She’s married and has four children.  In time she has developed two businesses.  On the one hand she’s a craftsperson weaving miniature clothes and little animals; she makes pictures of Andean scenes with natural wools and on the other hand she has a small neighborhood store in her home.  The requested loan will be used to expand the store and sell meat as well as to buy bolts of alpaca wool.  She indicates that because she uses alpaca wool it’s best to buy it at wholesale to earn profits.

When she is asked why she’s in Pro Mujer she answers that it’s because of the friends, the savings and the option to manage petty cash.

loans.use: To buy alpaca wool and beef for the store.

loans.name: Flor De Tuna Ii Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal FLOR DE TUNA II está ingresando al ciclo Nro. 1 y formará parte del centro focal de Alto Lima, aún no tienen experiencia en el trabajo como banca comunal pero tiene la confianza que este ciclo les servirá para conocerse y afianzar los lazos de amistad.  Está integrado por 8 personas,  7 mujeres y 1  varón.
Cada uno de los integrantes ya tiene negocio propio, ente los cuales se tiene: artesanía en goma eva, venta de mariscos, venta de joyas de plata, venta de calzados por catálogo, bazar, tienda de repuestos.
La Banca Comunal de FLOR DE TUNA está dirigida por una mesa directiva compuesta por  una presidenta, una tesorera y una secretaria de actas.
La  presidenta, la señora Narda ha participado  15 años y medio en la banca comunal "Flor de Tuna", este es su primer ciclo en la banca comunal  "Flor de Tuna II".  Con el tiempo ha desarrollado dos negocios, por un lado tiene un bazar que abrió por iniciativa propia y por otro lado elabora piñatas.  El crédito que está solicitando le servirá para la compra de material para elaborar las piñatas: esponja, plastoformo, pegamento.  Cuenta con el apoyo de su hermano para ayudarle en ambos negocios.  Las piñatas son repartidas a las tiendas que hicieron el pedido.
Cuando se le consulta por que está en Pro Mujer ella responde”salud” refiriendose al servicio de salud.
texts.en: The Flor de Tuna II Communal Bank is entering its first cycle  and will be part of the Alto Lima center. Although they do not have any experience working as a communal bank, they are confident that this cycle will help them get to know each other and strengthen the bonds of friendship. The group consistes of 8 persons, 7 women and 1 man. Each of the members has their own business, among which are: crafts made from rubber, sale of seafood, sale of silver jewelry, sale of shoes by catalog, a bazaar, and a parts store. The Flor de Tuna Communal Bank is governed by a board composed of a president, a treasurer and a recording secretary. The president, Narda, has participated for 15 years in the Flor de Tuna Communal Bank, this is her first cycle with the Flor de Tuna II Communal Bank. Over time she has developed two businesses. First has a bazaar that she opened herself and on the other hand she makes piñatas. The loan she is requesting will help buy supplies for making piñatas: foam, plastoform, glue. She has the support of her brother to help in both businesses. The piñatas are distributed to stores that order them. When asked why she is in Pro Mujer she answers "health", referring to the health service.

loans.use: Buy supplies for making piñatas: sponge, plastoform, glue

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve an internet cafe and computer maintenance shop

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe N. is from the city of RSTAN Village, Ozamiz City. She is 49 years old. Fe is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a business in transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Fe has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Fe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Abdullateef

texts.en:
Abdullateef is a young man from Tulkarem town. He is an engineer. Abdullateef is working with his dad in the farm they have, where they grow fruits and seasonal vegetables. Abdullateef took a loan from FATEN to purchase and install a greenhouse in the farm, and to be able to grow more vegetables in different seasons.

Abdullateef, who appears in the picture above, wants to improve the farm and increase the production. He and his father are taking care of the family household expenses.

loans.use: Purchasing a greenhouse to increase production

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a father of two daughters and two sons. Bassam has a farm where he raises animals for sale and dairy production.

Bassam took a loan from FATEN to purchase more goats and increase the production of the farm. Bassam was an employee but he is enjoying his work more as he is running a better operation which will secure a better future for his four children.

Bassam appears in the picture here in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: Purchasing more goats to raise

loans.name: Estrellas Del Cielo Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal Estrellas del Cielo está ingresando al ciclo Nro. 4, son mujeres entusiastas y con deseos de continuar formado parte del grupo, pues se sienten en confianza.   Pertenecen al centro focal de Villa Exaltación, está integrado por 8 mujeres.
Cada una de los integrantes ya tiene negocio propio, ente los cuales se tiene:  venta de cosméticos, confección de ropa, cafetería, repostería, venta de conservas, confitería, reciclaje de papel, chocolatería.  La Banca Comunal  Estrellas del Cielo está dirigida por una mesa directiva compuesta por  una presidenta, una tesorera y una secretaria de actas.
La  presidenta, la señora Iris ha participado  durante dos años y medio en bancas comunales, este es su cuarto ciclo en la banca comunal  Estrellas del Cielo. La señora Iris esta casada y junto a su esposo tienen bajo su cuidado a sus tres hijos.   El negocio que ocupa a la señora presidenta es el reciclaje de papel, ya son diez años,  cuenta con una tienda  donde acopia el papel y luego vende este papel a las fábricas que así lo requieran.  Le colabora una muchacha, pues la tienda está abierta de nueve de la noche a ocho de la noche, de lunes a sábado.  
El crédito que está solicitando le servirá para pagar a las personas que traigan el papel, la señora comenta que siempre debe tener dinero en efectivo para poder realizar la compra.
Cuando se le consulta por que está en Pro Mujer ella responde  “el crédito”.
texts.en:
The Estrellas del Cielo (Stars in the Sky) Communal Bank is in its fourth cycles.  They are enthusiastic women with the desire to continue being part of the group; they trust each other.  They belong to the Villa Exaltación regional center.  The bank is comprised of eight women.

Each one of the members has their own business.  Some of the businesses are selling cosmetics, making clothes, a café, making pastries, selling canned goods, a sweet shop, recycling paper, and making chocolates.  The Estrellas del Cielo Communal Bank is run by the board of directors.  The board is comprised of a president, a treasurer, and a secretary.

The president, Iris, has been in communal banks for two and a half years.  This is her fourth cycle in the Estrellas del Cielo Communal Bank.  Iris is married, and she lives with her husband.  They have three children under their care.  The president’s business is recycling paper.  She has had the business for ten years.  She has a store where she gathers the papers together.  She then sells this paper to the factories as they need it.  She works with a girl because the store is open from nine in the morning until eight at night from Mondays through Saturdays.

The loan she is requesting is to pay the people who bring the paper.  She says that she always needs to have cash to be able to make a purchase.

When asked why she is in Pro Mujer, she replied, “The loan”.

loans.use: To buy recycled paper

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Sin L., 24, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. L. is a housewife while her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food and USD 25 on the other necessary expenses. L. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more construction supplements to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more construction supplements to improve her husband's business

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem T., 51, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. T. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of USD 1 each per day to help cover the family expenses. The four children are employed, earning an income of USD 2 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food and USD 8 on the other necessary expenses. T. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for  the children to commute to work

loans.name: Bolivianitas Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal BOLIVIANITAS está ingresando al ciclo Nro. 3,  este es un grupo en crecimiento, en proceso de consolidación.   Forman parte del centro focal de Villa Exaltación, está integrado por 8 mujeres y 1 varón.
Cada una de los integrantes ya tiene negocio propio, entre los cuales se tiene: venta de cereales, comercio de víveres, Internet, macramé, venta de cosméticos, y artefactos, artesanías, expendio de comida, venta de chinelas, y venta de comida. La Banca Comunal  Bolivianitas está dirigida por una presidenta, una tesorera y una secretaria de actas, las mismas fueron elegidas por el grupo de socias y el socio.
La  presidenta, la señora Marianela ha participado  durante siete años en otras Bancas Comunales y en la Banca Comunal de Bolivianitas ya cuenta con dos años.   La señora Marianela actualmente se define como "soltera", pues debe cuidar de sus hijos sola, madre de cuatro hijos, tres viven con ella y uno ya tiene pareja y tiene su propio hogar;  el negocio de la señora Marianela es la venta de productos del hogar, tanto comestibles como electrodomésticos a pagos, comenzó con un capital muy pequeño hace 18 años.  El crédito que está solicitando la señora Marianela  le servirá incrementar el capital de trabajo y comprar lo que sus clientes solicitan ya sea víveres o electrodomésticos. Cuando se le consulta por que está en Pro Mujer ella responde "por que le gusta participar en el grupo”.
texts.en:
The Bolivianitas Communal Bank is entering its third cycle. It is a growing group in the process of consolidation. They are part of the Villa Exaltacion central office. The group is made up of 8 women and  1 man.
Each of the members already has their own business, such as: grain sales, supplies sales, Internet, macrame, cosmetics sales, and appliances, crafts, food packaging, slipper sales, and food sales. The Bolivianitas Communal Bank is managed by a president, treasurer and a secretary, all of whom were elected by the group members. The group president, Marianela, has been part of other Communal Banks for seven years, and has been part of the Bolovianitas Communal Bank for two years.
Marianela is currently single, so she has to take care of her children alone. She has four children, three of whom live with her and one of whom has a partner and a house. Marianela's business is selling home products--food and home electronics. She started with a very small amount of capital 18 years ago. 
Marianela is requesting a loan to increase her working capital and purchase what her customers are asking for, whether it be food items or home electronics. When asked why she is part of Pro Mujer, she replied "because I enjoy participating in the group".

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and home electronics on order

loans.name: Nourn

texts.en: Nourn R., 57, is married and lives with her husband and five children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia – one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. R. is a housewife, while two of her children are employed as security guards, earning $3 US each per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $66 US on food and $12 US on other expenses. R. is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase groceries to start a new business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy groceries to start a new business

loans.name: Joanne Kristine

texts.en: Joanne Kristine G. owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is a 25-year-old single woman from the town of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Joanne Kristine has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Joanne Kristine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Joanne Kristine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Chem M., 54, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia – one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. M. is a housewife while her husband is a farmer, earning $2 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. Two of her children are employed at a factory, earning $2 US each per day. Each month, the family has to spend $33 US on food and $32 US on other expenses. M. is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase a motorbike for the family. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

S. sells Cambodian noodles, earning $10 US per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning $12 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $75 US on food and $15 US on other expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for the family. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family

loans.name: Nonito

texts.en: Nonito G.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He is 52 years old, married and has three grown-up children. He is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Nonito has been in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Nonito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Nonito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his second loan from GDMPC. He plans to use additional income to improve and expand his business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
