texts.en:
Novelita V. is a 43-year-old married woman from the town of Banga. She has one child.

To make a living, Novelita raises crops, primarily rice, for sale. Novelita works hard to sustain her child's education. She dreams of success for her child.

Novelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Novelita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Lovis' Group

texts.en:
Lovis is a 54-year-old married man with four children living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He is a shop keeper and has been in this business for three years and the business has helped him meet day-to-day demands. He still has a challenge of limited capital and his desire is to have a wholesale shop.

Lovis intends to use the loan to buy rice, sugar and flour to sell. He is a member of Kabende Tukurakurane group where each member guarantees the other.

loans.use: To purchasing rice, sugar and flour to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia F. is from the village of Pedlagahan, Gingoog City. She is 57 years old. Lydia is married and has six adult children. 

To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, biscuits and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Lydia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods. This  will be the third loan taken out by Lydia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.ru:
Gulnar O. 22 qoda. Ona ne zamujem i ne imeyet detey. Gulnar yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Klabadjara i seychas jivet v Absheron regione vmese so svoimi roditelyami.
Gulnar okonchila universitet i teper qod kak rabotayet uchitelniccey. Ona ochen lubit svoyu rabotu i detey s kotorimi ona rabotayet.
Seychas Gulnar nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kompyuter dlya obucheniya detey i ix razvitiya v oblasti nauki.
texts.en:
Gulnar O., 22, is single. She does not have children. Gulnar is an internally displaced person who resettled with her parents from Klabadjar to Absheron. Gulnar is a university graduate and works as a teacher. She loves her job and her school children. Gulnar is applying for a loan in order to purchase a computer that would allow her to teach children and contribute to the development of their scientific thinking. 

.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie, 48, is a widow and has three children between 19 and 24 years old. All her children attend school. 

Marie sells different items in her boutique such as rice, beans, potatoes and cooking oil. 

She decided to request a loan to make her business grow and add more products to her sales. She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. She has a dream to invest in her children’s further studies.

loans.use: To add more products to sell

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique works as a tailor. She is 30 years old and married to a driver. They have two children ages 6 and 7. 

Angelique wishes to get this loan to buy more fabric to use in her tailoring business. She plans to renovate her house from the profits of the business. She dreams of growing her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to use in her tailoring business

loans.name: Ma. Conchita

texts.en:
Ma. Conchita is 42 years old, separated and supports her family by operating a food vending business selling Lechon. She lives in Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, Ma. Conchita is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 7,000 PHP. Ma. Conchita is borrowing 18,000 PHP so she can fund operations. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Conchita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. In the picture you will see her together with her helper in her business. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas M., 50 years old, owns a small shop located in the local market in Kompong Thom Province. To earn a living, Meas M. sells soft drinks and rice soup in the morning and she sells soup for evenings. She typically makes around $4 of profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable living. She is a widow and now she lives with her four children in her own house. Her husband died of illness for a few years ago. 

From step to step, Meas M. is running her business well because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. To earn more extra income, Meas M. wishes to have more funds to increase her capital to buy additional goods such as soft drinks, sweets, snack foods, and other items for sale which will allow her to increase her profit. This is why she has decided to take out a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, sweets, snack foods, and other items for sale

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn C. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. She is 23 years old and married. To make a living, Ailyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. She is also making and selling homemade sausage or longganisa. Ailyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ailyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ailyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Ailyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Ailyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen K. is 29 years old, married to Farefax, and they have two children aged 11 and two years old. 

Maureen has a beauty salon that she is running and also has a boutique within the salon. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by another client. She is in need of hair extensions and materials to add to her stock. Her monthly income is Kes 10,000.

Her desire is to open up another business in another town.

loans.use: Buy materials to add to her stock such as hair extensions

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey Y. is from the town of Banga. He is 40 years old and single. To make a living, Rey owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rey wishes to be a successful businessman.

Rey joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rey has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rey is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria D. is 42 years old, married, and has four children.  Her husband is a farmer.  She lives in the village of Lower Sto Nino, Mahayag Zamboanga del sur. She is a member in good standing at PMPC, which is the source for their additional capital for their gardening. With more to access gardening products, Gloria's customers will have more to buy at harvest  time. Gloria's income from sales is the main source for the family's needs. Gloria repaid her second loan at PMPC and is requesting a new loan for 7,000 PHP, which will be used for gardening.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Gardening

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma lives in the village of Malinawon, Molave Zamboanga Del Sur. She and her husband have three children. She earns a living as a farm laborer and her husband is a driver. 

Since she became a PMPC member she has a good record that she treasured for a long time which she said that PMPC is the source of their business capital which help for their financial situations. Alma earn much in her livestock to support family needs,and help them financially stable.She request for another loan availment in the amount of 10,000 Php,used for an additional inventory and capital.This loan taken for 6th cycle granted by PMPC.All about PAGLAUM MULTI- PURPOSE COOPERATIVE know as most PROGRESSIVE COOPERATIVE in NORTHWESTERN MINDANAO and REACHES TO POOR COMMUNITIES.

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene A. is 39 years old, married and has six school-aged children.She  is from the village of San Miguel, Gingoog City. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, and toothpaste, in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6 000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and beverages. This loan will be Arlene's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and beverages

location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn C. is a married woman who lives in Bantayanan, Brgy. Molaw, Compostela, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: abaca weaving and a motorcycle operator business. Her husband, Randy C., is 33 years old. He buys and sells fire wood to earn his living. They have 2 children who are 3 and 7 years old. 

Ginalyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ginalyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 6,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing 11,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more materials for weaving so that she can continue to save up for future home improvement and for her children’s education. Ginalyn C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for weaving

loans.name: Pius Wambua

texts.en:
Pius Wambua M. is 44 years old and married to Kamene who contributes to the family income. He has five children aged between 17 and four years. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past four years with an income of KES. 20,000 per month. 


This is his third loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous ones well and on time. He wants to use this loan to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to improve the living standard of his children and give them quality education.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna E. was born in 1977. She lives in Koti village, Ijevan area. Ruzanna is married and has 3 children, who are already going to school. 

Ruzanna and her husband are engaged in animal breeding and land cultivation. On their farm they breed cows, pigs, turkeys and chickens. They grow wheat and potato plants as well. Thanks to their occupation, they support their family and also bought a truck, which they use to transfer fodder to their farm, to transport cows to mountains in summer months, and to bring firewood to their home. 

Ruzanna asks for an 800,000 AMD loan to buy some calves and a sow, which will allow Ruzanna to develop her farm and to increase her family’s income in the future.

loans.use: To buy some calves and a sow for her farm

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou A. is from the village of Maribucao, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old. Marilou is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks and other delicacies like rice and cheese cakes in the local community. She is also buying and selling coconuts for copras. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Marilou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 35 years old, single, and has adopted children.  She owns a restaurant. Her business has helped her to pay the children’s school fees. She is requesting for a loan in order to purchase milk, foodstuffs, and beer. She hopes to expand her business and pay her children’s school fees with the profits she makes.

loans.use: To purchase food, milk, and beer for her restaurant.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden D. is 39 years old, separated, and has five school-aged children.  She lives in the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. To make a living, Eden owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling specialty food products such as chicken and pork kebab, boiled eggs or balot, peanuts, and chicharon in the local community. Eden has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. She is also running a retail store selling snack foods and canned goods.

In 2010, Eden joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eden has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional ingredients and acquire working capital. Eden is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat. This loan will be Eden's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat

loans.name: Samwel Mwangi

texts.en:
Samuel  is 48 years old, married to Lucy Wambui,  and they have three children.  He has been running his dairy farm for a period of two years with an income of KES. 4,000 per  month. 


He is taking his  third loan from KADET LTD  after successfully repaying the previous ones. He plans to buy another cow, maize jam, and bran for the cow. 


He hopes to improve the living standard of his family and give his children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy another cow, maize jam, and bran for the cow

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng S. is a 25-year-old married woman who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She and her husband earn a living by making mortars which are hewn from hard stone. She also takes mortars from other makers and sells them for a fee. This family is able to earn a profit of on average $13 per day in order to cover all the family expense. The couple got married several years ago and they are blessed with only one young child. 

Because her business process is going well from day to day, Chheng S. intends to invest more capital in order to buy more mortars to sell.

loans.use: To buy more mortars to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna V. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. She is 44 years old. Edna is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing manicure & pedicure services to local community members. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Edna is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed like nail polish, cuticle remover & foot scrubs. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Edna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials like nail polish, cuticle remover & foot scrubs

loans.name: Anecita's Group

texts.en:
Anecita lives in the village of Miligan, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a farmer. They have 4 children; one daughter is a teacher and she helps them meet their everyday needs. Anecita is the group leader among the 3 members of this group loan, which is offered by Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Their group has had a good performance record ever since they became PMPC members.

Anecita is running a piggery which is the income source for their family's primary needs. Since she became a PMPC member, she has begun to access more capital for her piggery with her husband's support.

Anecita is requesting a new loan  in the amount of 10,000 PhP will be used as additional capital for their piggery. That is her 7th loan taken out from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.

PAGLAUM MULTI-PURPOSE COOPERATIVE is the most progressive cooperative in Northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to poor rural communities.

loans.use: Piggery

loans.name: Joyce Njeri

texts.en:
Joyce is 57 years old, married to Henry K., and they have three children. She has been in the poultry business for a period of one year with an income of  KES 11,000 per month. 

This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she intends to use it to buy poultry feed and expand her poultry farm. She hopes to expand her farming by at least 1000 chicks to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and expand her poultry farm

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a twenty-six-year-old hard-working father of one child living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda, longing to build a permanent house in the next five years. He operates an internet café; it has been in operation for three years and the business is still profitable. He started as just an employee but is now an employer and his business plan is to set up three centres in town. Francis needs the loan to buy a photocopy machine and a scanner.

loans.use: Buying a photocopying machine and a scanner

loans.name: Ean

texts.en:
Ean S., 52, resides with her family in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. sells beverages and food, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 750 to purchase more beverages and food to improve the current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her fourth loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more beverages and food to improve the current business

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en:
Felicita owns a charcoal business, and she has been in this business for seven years. Felicita is 39 years old, married with six children who are between four months and nineteen years old. Five of her children go to school and two adopted orphans she cares for also attend school. Her husband works as a mason. 

Felicita has requested this loan to buy more charcoal to sell and she intends to use the profits for paying school fees for her children. She dreams of having a truck in the future, for charcoal transportation from her local area to the town where there is a big number of consumers.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rosamar

texts.en:
Rosamar G. is a farmer. She grows rice in the small town of Banga, South Cotabato. All her life, she has been a farmer. She is happy that until now, she has been able to provide for the needs of her family.

With 4 years experience, she has been successful. But since most of her profit goes to family expenses, she needs this loan to help her get ahead in her business. She plans to have a bigger farm someday. 

At 26, she is determined to continue her business, since it provides for her family's basic needs.
 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to fund her farm

loans.name: Virginie

texts.en:
Virginie is 48 years old. She has 5 children aged between eighteen and twenty-eight. They have all been in school, apart from one who did not want to go to school. 

Virginie sells green bananas; she is proud of her business and she has done it for nine years. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more green bananas and with the profits she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: Buying more green bananas

loans.name: Den

texts.en:
Den B. is a 34-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Cham Province. Den B. is married to Mr. Seng Sang, age 37, who works in construction, and makes an income of approximately $3 each day to share the responsibility with Den B. for the family’s needs. This couple currently has four children, and all of them are single. Two are working in garment factories as sewing workers and have a formal salary every month. 

Den B. would like a loan of $1100 in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for farming. She will use this land to farm.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land in good condition for farming

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is fifty-five years old, married with ten children, living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a dream of educating his children. He has a number of income-generating activities which include farming, trading in beans and maize and grinding  agricultural output. His major challenge is customers who buy on credit and take a long time to pay, and his business dream is to have a store for all his produce. Robert intends to use the loan to buy maize and beans for planting.

loans.use: Buying maize and beans for planting

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna J.  has a business  rice farming. It is her hope to expand her business, and a loan from CEVI will allow her to buy more seeds and fertilizers. With the additional income from a larger business, Rosanna will be able to provide enough food and other necessities for her family. Rosanna also grows coconut trees and chickens.

Rosanna has three children, and she plans to help fund their education with the additional income that the loan will provide. In the future, she hopes to continue expanding her farm and to take advantage of other business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Tohirjon

texts.ru: Исмоилов Тохирчон проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 27 лет. Женат. Детей не имеет. Живет вместе с родителями. Образование среднее. Три года как занимается перевозками. Он в основном развозит людей по маршруту Хамадони - Душанбе. Кредит берет для ремонта машины, чтобы обеспечит безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Tohirjon  I., 27, lives in Hamadoni. He is married but does not have children. He lives with his parents. Tohirjon has secondary education and works as a taxi driver on Hamadoni-Dushanbe highway. He is applying for a loan to repair his car and ensure the safety of his clients.

loans.use: car repair

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel E., a farmer, lives in Banga, South Cotabato. His income as a farmer is enough to support his family's basic needs. He grows rice. Most of the production of his farm is reserved for family consumption; the rest is sold to rice traders in their location.

He was glad to join the CEVI micro-credit program because of the micro-insurance benefits. He believes that by accessing funds from CEVI, he will be able to expand his business and better support his family's needs.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Etoile Group

texts.fr: Djuma R.  est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Etoile,  âgée de 47 ans, veuve, mère de 7 enfants orphelins de père. Seulement  1 enfant qui étudie, 4 n’étudient pas faute de moyens financiers et  deux autres ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Son mari fut décède suite d’une maladie inopinée.  Elle est vendeuse de boissons (bière Primus et Fanta) à son domicile. Il ya 25 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle  démarra son business  avec son fonds propre. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits brassicoles  (10 casiers de Primus, 5 casiers de Fanta) pour augmenter le stock en volume et en valeurs. Le reste  d’argent  de crédit lui servira pour acheter la farine de manioc pour alimentation des enfants. En plus, elle ambitionne  augmenter son épargne et acheter une parcelle pour sa famille. La cliente Djuma R.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe Etoile est composé de 38 membres.
texts.en: Djuma R. is an entrepreneur and she is the president of the group, named Etoile (Star). She is 47 years old, a widow, and the mother of 7 children who were orphaned by their father. Only 1 of the children is in school. Four of them are not in school for the lack of financial resources, and two others already have their own homes. Her husband passed away following an unexpected illness. She sells drinks (Primus brand beer and Fanta) from her home. She has 25 years in the business. She started out with her own funds. Later she had the benefit of a loan from IMF Hekima (Kiva Field Partner), amounting to $50. This new loan will be used to purchase more brewery products (10 cases of Primus, 5 cases of Fanta) in order to supplement her inventory, in volume and in value. The remainder of the funds will be used to purchase cassava flour, a source of nutrition for the children. In addition, she hopes to increase their investments with the purchase of a parcel of land for the family. Djuma R. is thankful to Hekima for their actions towards the poor who are excluded from traditional banks. The Etoile group is made up of 38 members.

loans.use: To purchase 10 cases of Primus, 5 cases of Fanta, and cassava flour.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married lady with six children.  For three years, she has been selling fish in Kawangware open-air market.  Being a business-lady, she decided to join Fadhili group in Faulu, Kenya so that she could easily access loans. Through the group, she has previously serviced a loan of 40,000 KES. She is glad to be involved with Faulu Kenya because she has managed to grow her business. She hopes to become a major supplier of fish in the market place in the future.

Eunice has requested another loan of 70,000 KES to buy sacks for storage and add stock of dried and smoked fish.

loans.use: To buy sacks for storage and add stock of dried and smoked fish

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Run V., 28, makes and sells rice noodles in the Battambang province. He has been making and selling rice noodles since 2008 and is able to make about 6 USD of profit each day. He is married and has two young children living at home to support. Run V. is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase more rice to make noodles.

loans.use: To purchase rice to make noodles

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a food kiosk (stall) and cereals shop for the last seven years, selling from the roadside to her neighbors and passersby. Rehema faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During holiday season, the price of food products is very high and hence a decrease in demand for the food products. She hopes to open a big cereal shop in the future.

With the 15,000 KES loan, Rehema wants to purchase a bundle of maize flour, cooking fat oil and coconuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of maize flour, cooking fat oil and coconuts

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Ouch S., 46, is married and lives with four of her children in the Battambang province. She is a farmer, growing rice and vegetables. On average, she is able to make about 1.60 USD of profit each day. Her husband earns 3 USD per day selling vegetables at the local market. Three of the children are in school, while the other one is employed at a local casino. Ouch S. is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a trailer and a water pump.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer and water pump

loans.name: Isaack

texts.en: Isaack is 40 years old and married with two children. He was able to start his business selling plastic chairs and buckets with a capital of 5,000 KES. He has been running the business for 15 years and has managed to expand. Thanks to Faulu Kenya for their financial support through loans. He hopes to grow his profit margin three times. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy chairs and buckets.

loans.use: To buy plastic chairs and buckets

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey B., 22, is single and lives with his parent and his younger brother in the Battambang province. He is a moto-taxi driver, earning 6 USD of profit each day. His mom is a waitress in the local restaurant. On average, she is able to make 3 USD per day. Srey B. is asking for a loan of 1,200 USD to replace an old and unreliable motorbike. (Srey B. is pictured with his mother behind.)

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Hun C. is 35 years old.  She lives with her old mother and her niece in the Battambang province. She sells grocery products and grows corn to help support her family. She typically makes $22 a day. For the last three years, her farming of corn has not done well because of the weather changes. Fortunately, her grocery business has been successful. Currently, she has a large number of grocery items to sell to her local customers. Hun C. is asking for a loan of $500 to expand her current grocery store and to buy fertilizer to grow corn.

loans.use: To expand grocery store and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a member of Faulu Kenya under the Vision group.  He is a 23-year-old businessman who operates a music shop and a mobile phone shop for a living.  His business is located in the Kibera slums hence most of his customers are low-income earners.  He has been engaged in the business for three years.  Over the years he has been running his business, he has learned how to manage his business finances through the training offered by Faulu Kenya.

He has requested 30,000 Kes to buy mobile phones, cassettes, and CDs.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones, cassettes, and CDs

loans.name: Pendeza Group

texts.fr: Tembeya R. Antoinnette  est entrepreneur, trésorière du groupe, âgée de 45 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants dont 2 enfants etudient, 2 n’étudient pas faute de moyens financiers et 2 autres ont leurs propres foyers.  Son conjoint est chômeur, sans emploi. La cliente Tembeya R. Antoinnette    est vendeuse des  tomates, arachides, légumes, oignons, etc. au marchee sectoriel de Ndosho. Elle  commença ce business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Avant de joindre cette activité, jadis, elle vendait les divers dans un kiosque. Son capital d’affaire initial fut 30$. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima de 50$ au début de  2010. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits (2 paniers de tomates, 50 kg d’arachides, etc.) et  ajouter un nouveau produits celui de vente poisson, qu’elle veut également entreprendre pour diversifie son business.  En plus, elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle et construire et laisser la vie de locataire. La cliente Tembeya R. Antoinnette  remercie Hekima pour  ses crédits sans relance en faveur de pauvres. Le groupe Pendeza est constitué de 32 membres.
texts.en: Tembeya R. Antoinnette is an entrepreneur and she is the treasurer of the group. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. Two of her children are in school, 2 are not going to school for the lack of financial resources, and 2 have their own homes. Her husband is unemployed. Tembeya R. Antoinnette is a merchant who sells tomatoes, peanuts, vegetables, onions etc, at in the sector's market of Ndosho. She started her business with her own money, which she received from her husband. Prior to the business she has currently, she sold various merchandise from a kiosk. Her start up capital funds was $30. In early 2010, she benefited from a loan from IMF Hekima (Kiva Field Partner) amounting to $50. This new loan will be used to purchase more products (2 baskets of tomatoes, 50Kg of peanuts, etc.) and to add new products for resale, including fish, and to diversify her business. In addition she would like to purchase a parcel of land where to build a life as a homeowner. Tembeya R. Antoinnette is thankful to Hekima for the loans granted to the poor. The group Pendeza is made up of 32 members.

loans.use: To purchase 2 baskets of tomatoes, 50kg of peanuts, and fish.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 45-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children. He has worked in the car repairs field for 21 years, and in 1990 he opened his own car spare parts shop. Parallel to this, he owns a small car mechanics garage. In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses. It is often not enough to have an office salary or a small shop to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional car spare parts for his shop so he can satisfy his customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase additional car spare parts for his shop

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over fourteen years, she has operated a mat-weaving business, selling from home to her neighbours. In addition she also sells kerosene which contributes to her sources of income. Fatuma faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to establish a cereals shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase palm leaves, materials used in weaving mats for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase palm leaves used in weaving mats for sale

loans.name: Abdulhakim

texts.en:
Abdulhakim is married with four children. He sells men's clothes and shoes at the market, and e takes his entire inventory with him by car and provides local customers with the clothing they need. Abdulhakim has been in this business for 6 years; he is a hard-working person. His goal is to fix up his house and take good care of his children. He wants to borrow 6000 Somoni to purchase seasonal inventory. The loan would help Abdulhakim to increase his sales and reach his goals faster.   

                                                                  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly G., 54 years old, runs a small farm. She also runs a small sari-sari store where she sells different products. She lives in Banga, South Cotabato in Mindanao. She dreamed of improving her house and expanding her businesses. Through having a farm business, she finds herself able to attend to all her family needs. 

She has three children. She is supporting their education. She wants all of her children to succeed in their studies so that when they are older, they can land better employment.

She chose CEVI because it has an insurance coverage package for all of its clients.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her businesses

loans.name: Usmon

texts.ru: Тагойназарзод Усмон проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 35 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается птицеводством. У него имеются индюки и птицы. Он в основном разводит их для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 8 лет. Кредит берет для покупки индюка и корма.
texts.en: T. Usmon, 35, lives with his five children and wife in Yavan. He has secondary education. He makes a living by breeding poultry. He has turkey and chicken, which he breeds mostly for sale. Having been in this business for 8 years, he is applying for a loan in order to buy a turkey and fodder.

loans.use: to buy a turkey and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing new goods

loans.name: Patrick Kinyanjui

texts.en:
Patrick Kinyanjui R. is 60 years old and married to Monicah Wanjiru. He has been farming for a period of two years with an income of KES. 5,000 per month.  

He has never borrowed from any MFI, and this is his first loan from KADET LTD. He intends to use it to buy seedlings, pay labour, and buy fertilizer. 

He hopes to settle on his farm after developing it and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, pay labour, and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 31 years old. She has two children aged 6 and 8. She owns a shop in which she sells soft drinks, Vaseline, soap, sugar and salt. Françoise is requesting a loan in order to buy more Vaseline, soap, and salt to increase her profits. Françoise’s business is doing well and she has been in this business for 10 years. With the profits she hopes to buy food for her family and put aside some savings.

loans.use: Buying more items for her shop

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita A., 51 years old, is a farmer from Banga, South Cotabato. She has five children. She wants to expand her business so that she can send all her children to school. She thinks that funding from CEVI will help her grow her business more. She will use the money from CEVI to buy more seeds and other farm inputs. In that way, she will be able to earn more and support the basic needs in their household.

The income that she will generate from growing rice will also be utilized in paying school fees and home supplies.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married woman from Lebanon, living with her husband and three children who are attending school. She cooperates with her husband who works in the construction field in meeting the family's income needs. After having 8 years of experience in the clothing field, she decided in 2005 to open a clothing store. She purchases her products from a local clothing center. She has obtained 3 Kiva loans and she has been a very good client with punctual payments. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase supplementary products so she can increase her sales and therefore improve her family’s financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary products

loans.name: Kitumbua

texts.en:
Kitumbua is a single woman with two children, both of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over fifteen years, she has operated a firewood business, selling from home to her neighbours and food kiosk (stall) operators. Kitumbua faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season it becomes hard to get enough firewood for resale. She hopes to buy charcoal and firewood for resale on  wholesale terms in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase 10 bags of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase 10 bags of firewood for resale

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda E. is from Banga, South Cotabato. She is a farmer. She does this to earn her livelihood. All her life, she has been taking care of the rice plants. 

She wishes to expand her business. To do that, she needs to increase her harvest. Funding from CEVI will help her buy fertilizers and quality rice seeds. In this way, she will be able to ensure a high quality harvest as well. 

Through planting rice, she is able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and quality rice seeds

loans.name: Mary Njoki

texts.en:
Mary is 23 years old, married to Edward Kiarie who contributes to the family income, and they have one child. She practices mixed farming, that is, both  crop and dairy farming. She has been in the business for a period of seven years with an income of KES. 7,000 per month.


She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, and Mary is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD. She intends to use it to buy animal feed and pay for labour. She has no history with any other MFI. 


Mary hopes to have a large dairy farm so as to increase their income. This will enable her to  improve the family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and pay for labour.

loans.name: Gloriose

texts.en:
Gloriose is 32 years old, married and has two children who are six and eight years old. Both her children are enrolled in school. She has two orphans she helps in terms of paying school fees for them. 

Gloriose owns a shop where she sells various items such as cooking oil, sodas, rice and many more. She decided to get this loan to add more merchandise to sell. She says with this profit she will pay school fees and the remainder will be meant for savings. In the future, she has a desire to buy a vehicle for transportation which seems to earn more income than the shop she has currently.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell such as cooking oil, sodas, rice and many more

loans.name: La Victoire Group

texts.fr: Zaina G.  est entrepreneur, secrétaire du groupe la Victoire, âgée de 52 ans, mariée, mère de 2 enfants dont le fils ainé a 36 ans et le cadet 33 ans. Tous sont diplômés et responsables de leurs propres foyers. Son conjoint est technicien mécanographe. La cliente Zaina G.  est couturière et  vendeuse des habits enfants à son domicile.  Elle fut enseignante, elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre issu de son salaire. Elle a également eu le concours de son mari dans l’évolution de son entreprise.  Il ya 38 ans qu’elle fait la coupe couture. Elle bénéficia le premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima de 50$ au début de  2009. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux matériels de couture (pagnes, fils, broderies, mordoré, dentelle, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne construire un grand atelier de référence dans la ville de Goma, bien équipé et former aussi les membres de sa famille en coupe couture. Selon elle, la coupe couture c’est la vie. L’existence de l’homme sur la terre est conditionnée par l’habillement.  La cliente Zaina G.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe la Victoire est constitué de 14 membres.
texts.en: Zaina G. is en entrepreneur and the secretary of the "La Victoire" Group. She is 52 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children; the eldest is 36 and the youngest is 33. They are both educated and have their own homes.  Her husband is a mechanic technician. Zaina G. is a seamstress and she sells children's clothing from her home. She was a teacher but she started her own business with money she saved from her salary. She also received support from her husband in the development of her business. It has been 38 years since she started as a seamstress. In early 2009, she accessed her first loan from IMF Hekima (Kiva Field Partner), amounting to $50. Her new loan will be used to purchase more tailoring materials (fabrics, threads, embroidery materials, metallic fabrics, lace, etc.). In addition, she hopes to build a   well equipped large shop in the city of Goma, where she could also train members of the family   in sewing arts According to her, sewing is life. The existence of man on earth is proportioned by clothing. Zaina G. is thankful to Hekima for their support of the poor who are excluded from traditional banks. The "La Victoire" group is made up of 14 members.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials (fabric, threads, laces, etc.)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 43 years old, married with five children. Four of his children and two others whom he cares for attend school. His wife helps him in running the business. Samuel sells fruit and he has spent two years in this business. He needs this loan to buy more fruit to sell and he hopes to use the profits that he is anticipating from this business to renovate his house. He wants to sell more fruit in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Marie Gorethe

texts.en: Marie Gorethe is 30 years old, married with three children, aged between two and ten. She is married to a driver. Marie Gorethe sells charcoal as well as foodstuffs. She has requested this loan to add more foodstuffs as well as charcoal to her business inventory. With the profits she will build a residential house because she is tired of renting. She dreams to have food in stock in the future.

loans.use: To add more foodstuffs and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other one is still young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a retail shop for the past four years, selling retail to her neighbours and passersby. Mishi hopes to open a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and coconuts for resale

loans.name: Yuldosh

texts.ru: Эшкозиев Юлдош житель Яванского района. Ему 60 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. 15 лет как занимается животноводством. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота и корма.
texts.en: E. Yuldosh lives in the Yavan region. He's sixty years old, married and has five children. He has a high school level of education and for the past fifteen years has bred cattle. He fattens the animals and later sells them for a profit. He's asking for a loan to buy some cattle and the food they require.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and feed

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is a mother of two children, two and four. She is 27 years old. One of her children isn’t school-aged yet. Alphonsine owns a shop in which she sells sugar and rice and she also sells beer. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more sugar, rice and beer in order to enlarge her business. She plans to renovate her house, pay her children’s school fees, and buy food for her family.

loans.use: Buying more food items such as sugar and beer for her shop

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna P., 55 years old, is from the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She provides food in their community by running a rice farm. She also grows root crops. 

She would like to expand her business more. She wanted to apply for a loan at CEVI to buy farm supplies for her rice farm. She plans to buy quality seeds and fertilizers.

The products in her farm also help her buy the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: to buy quality seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old married man living with his wife. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a plumber since 1992. In 2002, he decided to work as a freelance plumber depending on customers' requests. He is the only income provider of his family. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and he was an excellent client with payments on time. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed products so he can enlarge his business and be able to stick with multiple construction projects as a result of increasing his income.

loans.use: to purchase needed products

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en:
Marie Gorette is 32 years old. She is married and has five children aged 2 to 12 years old. All her children are in school apart from the youngest who hasn’t begun school yet. 

Marie Gorette sells and recharges batteries. She has done this business for 8 years while her husband repairs motorcycles and cars.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy a motorcycle. She plans to save and buy a house in future.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel owns a shop which has a variety of items such as sugar, lotions, salt, soap, and beans. He has had this business for three years. Samuel is 39 years old and married with one child who is three years old. Samuel will use this loan to buy more merchandise to sell. The profits from his expanded business will be used to reinvest in the business for its growth. He hopes to be a businessman with a leading shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima A. is married and has one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a shoe selling business for the past six years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. In addition to shoes, she sells handbags, which contributes to her other source of income. Halima faces a major challenge of delayed payments by clients who purchase on credit. She hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan, Halima wants to purchase 15 pairs of shoes and 10 bags for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: To purchase 15 pairs of shoes and 10 bags for resale

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en: Yvonne owns a business that sells cattle. She is 23 years old, married, and has two children, one and four. Her husband sells meat. Yvonne has been selling cattle for seven years. Her loan will be used to buy goats, cows and hens to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy new equipment to use in establishing a restaurant business.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to sell

loans.name: Roseminda

texts.en:
Roseminda N. owns a small rice farm. She began this business in order to help support her children's education. She has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Roseminda has requested a loan from CEVI in order to purchase more seeds and fertilizers for her farm. She hopes that this will increase her business. She intends to use the profit to finance her children's daily fare and school fees, as well as provide for the family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married woman living in Lebanon with her husband and 2 school-aged children. In addition to her husband’s income (he works as a taxi driver), she represents the second income source for the family. After having 15 years of experience in the hairdressing field, she decided to work as a hairdresser from her house. She hopes to expand her business, especially so that she can build a good business reputation.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional cosmetics products since she wants to offer her clients more beauty services so she can attract a maximum number of clients.

loans.use: to purchase additional cosmetics products

loans.name: Aida Sy

texts.fr: Madame Aida Sy S. vit   à Diack Sao, une des   localités environnantes de Bambilor. Elle a 45 ans. Depuis plus de 10 ans elle exerce l’achat et la vente de lait frais, lait caillé et œufs  frais. Elle  a démarré son activité depuis qu’elle a rejoint le domicile conjugal. L’objectif recherché était de parvenir à satisfaire ses  besoins  personnels. Madame S. est membre du guichet de Bambilor depuis juillet 2010. Elle n’a jamais bénéficié de prêt au sein de l’institution. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour acheter des produits destinés  a renforcer son commerce. Son souhait est d’augmenter son épargne.
texts.en: Mrs. Aida Sy S. lives in Diack Sao, one of the surrounding districts of Bambilor. She is 45 years old. For the past 10 years she has been buying and selling fresh milk, cheese curds, and fresh eggs. She started out her business when she moved into her husband's home. Her objective was to provide for her personal needs. Mrs. S. has been a member of the communal bank Bambilor since 2010. She has never had a loan through this organization. She requests a loan of 100 000 FRS in other to purchase products to supplement her business. Her wish is to increase her savings.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 10 years, she has operated a fish-selling business from home, selling to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sells coconuts which contributes to her other source of income. Mishi faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the dry summer season, the supply of coconuts in the market is very low so does not meet the customers' demand. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase 20 sacks of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Musingi Bora Group

texts.fr: Antoinette K. B.  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe Musingi Bora, âgée de 44 ans, mariée, mère de 11 enfants.  Son conjoint est menuisier. La cliente Antoinette K. B.  est vendeuse des  farines de manioc et de haricot. Elle expose des produits dans un entrepôt agricole et parfois au long de la route, sur la voie publique.il ya 7 ans qu’elle fait ce business.  Elle  demarra cette affaire  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari avec un capital de 50$. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima de 50$ au début de  2010. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits (8 sacs de farines de manioc, 1 sac de haricots,  à revendre, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne voir ses enfants  finir leurs études, acheter une parcelle, avoir un entrepôt autonome pour ses marchandises. La cliente Antoinette K. B.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Musingi Bora est constitué de 26 membres.
texts.en: Antoinette K. B. is an entrepreneur and the leader of the "Musingi Bora" group. She is 44 years old, married, and the mother of 11 children. Her husband is a carpenter. Antoinette K. B. is a merchant who sells cassava and bean flour. She displays her products for sale at an agricultural depot and sometimes along a stretch of road, for the general public. She has 7 years in the business. She started her business with her own funds, which she received from her husband. Her capital fund was $50. In early 2010, she accessed her first loan through IMF Hekima (Kiva Field Partner), amounting to $50. Her new loan will be used to purchase new products (8 sacks of cassava flour, and 1 sack of beans for resale etc.). In addition, she endeavors to see her children complete their schooling, to purchase parcel of land, and to have an independent depot for her merchandise. Antoinette K. B. is thankful to Hekima for their support to the poor who are excluded from traditional banks. The Musingi Bora group is made up of 26 members.

loans.use: To purchase 8 sacks of cassava flour and 1 sack of beans.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old married man. He is from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and 2 siblings. He has worked as a plumber for more than 15 years and in 2002 he decided to work on his own, depending on customers' demands. At the same time, he also works in a construction company. In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses to handle the family’s expenses. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and he was an excellent client. 
 
Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy additional products that will help him to expand his business and stick with several construction projects.

loans.use: buy additional products and stick with construction projects

loans.name: Sirojidin

texts.ru: Гуриев Сирочидин проживает в районе А. Джоми. Ему 36 лет. Он женат, у него четверо детей. Образование среднее. Зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота и корма.
texts.en: G. Sirochidin lives in the A. Jomi region. He's thirty-six years old, married and has four children. He has a high school level of education and earns a living by breeding large farm animals. He fattens and then sells the cattle for profit. He's requesting a loan in order to purchase some cattle and cattle feed.

loans.use: To buy cattle and feed

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra Sustiquer lives in the community of Banga, South Cotabato. She is 48 years old with five children.

Sandra grows rice and corn for a living. She began this business because she wanted to improve the family’s financial situation and support her children’s studies. She also runs a sari-sari (variety) store. Recently, however, Sandra has begun to face financial difficulties. She doesn't have enough money to reinvest in her business. As a result, her sales and profits have gone down. Thus, Sandra has requested a loan from CEVI in order to purchase fertilizers and seeds for the farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing new goods to sell

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en:
A. Firuz is a hard-working farmer because he knows that the only way he can support and provide for his loved ones is through hard work and dedication. Consequently, he leaves home every day at dawn to work in his farm and to look after his cattle. Firuz wishes to expand his business by purchasing calves and fodder for them. That is the reason that he is asking for a loan. Firuz will always cherish the memory of all those who gave him a helping hand when he needed it by granting him his request.        


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves and fodder for them

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.en:
Rajabgul is a young divorced lady with faith in a good future. She lives and works in Dushanbe, selling towels and kerchiefs in the central marketplace. Rajabgul launched her small venture 5 years ago and has gained much experience and a loyal clientele. Rajabgul is requesting a loan of 7500 Somoni to increase her working capital. She hopes to continue developing her business and improving her living standards. Rajabgul has proved to be a reliable and solvent client.

loans.use: Increasing her working capital

loans.name: Mirzoahmad

texts.en:
Mirzoahmad is married and has one child. He sells rice in the local market. His stall is well known for the good prices he offers, and his affordability compared to market prices. Mirzoahmad knows his customers’ preferences and always offers them the best quality of goods. He has been selling rice for a total of 25 years, with consistent profits. 

Mirzoahmad is requesting a loan of 7700 Somoni to increase the assortment of his goods. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profit. We believe that Mirzoahmad's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow him to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship.

loans.use: Purchasing more rice for resale

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
K. Rasul is 48 years old, married and has two children. He is the sole breadwinner for his family, and his only income comes from raising and selling large livestock at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers from farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers.

Today Rasul is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. To do this, he needs $2500 USD to purchase additional young cattle. Rasul has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.

About Tajikistan:

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda N. is married and the mother of one daughter and two sons. Her husband is employed, and her children are still in school.

Hilda owns and runs a tailoring workshop and works with another women from Nablus. Hilda wants to increase production so as to serve more customers as well as raise the salaries of the women working with her.

Hilda has taken a loan from FATEN to purchase another sewing machine and improve her workshop. She appears here in her workshop.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent O. is 35 years old and married to Henry. They have three children who are all in school.

Millicent has a business of selling second-hand clothes and she has been doing it for the past seven years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more clothes to add to her stock. Her monthly income is Kes 30,000. 


Her desire is to see her children through school.

loans.use: Buy more clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
Jamshed N. was born in 1970 in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is married and supports his wife and four children.

A livestock breeder for five years, Jamshed is very dynamic, serious, and entrepreneurial. He is proposing to expand his herd and repair his enclosure so as to meet the needs of a rather large clientele from his village and the surrounding neighborhood. Some buyers come from more than twenty kilometers from his village.

With this goal in mind, Jamshed is requesting a loan that will serve as business capital. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve living conditions for his household and also make some investments.

loans.use: To acquire capital for purchasing cattle

loans.name: Barot

texts.en:
Barot is married with four children. He is a small entrepreneur selling groceries. Barot owns a small storage facility in a local market. He and his son (in the photo) have much experience working in this sphere of trade. Barot launched his business over 6 years ago. His business is known for its reasonable pricing policy and free delivery service. One of his plans for the near future is to buy a facility for his business that he could own instead of renting a building. 

Barot is always on the go. He is very determined and knows how to achieve his goals. This time Barot is seeking a 1500 USD loan to purchase foodstuffs to expand his inventory. He is hoping to use the generated profit to finish remodeling his apartment, which he couldn’t complete due to financial constraints.

loans.use: Purchasing more foodstuffs to expand his inventory

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.en:
Muhiddin is 38 years old and lives with his wife and six children. From a young age he demonstrated a talent for agriculture. Muhiddin has always tried to be very responsible and very content with his farm work. When he finishes caring for his crops, he goes to help his father, because he wants to repay his father’s efforts. What his father likes best out of the whole agricultural process is the marketing, because he always hopes to get a good price for his crops. But once he gets to the market, he gets a little clumsy and sometimes loses track of the accounting. Muhiddin always tries to help him out with this. 

The loan Muhiddin now is asking for is to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for his varied crops. The loan will greatly improve Muhiddin’s income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Kholburi

texts.en:
I. Kholburi is 25 years old. He is married with 3 kids. Kholburi is dedicated to his agricultural business. Having little knowledge in the beginning, he had to learn a lot about farming. Now, he has acquired a fair amount of experience in agriculture. Currently, Kholburi is very happy, because of his kids who are the motivation for his desire to grow his business. He approached IMON International to obtain a loan to buy more inputs: seeds and fertilizer to sow for a good harvest so he can take care of his children and his home.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en:
Sultan A. is a 59 year-old farmer and is married, with three children. Sultan worked as a tractor driver and, at the same time, started his own business in cattle breeding and farming. With the initial sum of 5,000 Kyrgyz Soms, he cultivated land with corn, sugar beets, and barley.  He managed to develop his farm with two bull calves, ten sheep, geese and chickens. All these activities allowed him to purchase a truck and open a small shop, where his wife sells different kinds of foodstuffs.  
In order to increase the number of cattle, Sultan is applying for loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Soms. With the revenues, he plans to renovate his house and host his son's wedding.
