She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 7,350 Philippines pesos (PHP). Susana is borrowing PHP 13,000 so that she can fund her business operations. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Susana aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Fund her business operations

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Adama. She is married and has three children, ages 6, 8 and 12. In 2000, Adama established her women's bags business. She began her business because she inherited it from her mother. Before, she had helped her mother with the business for many years. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 300,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more used bags. Adama hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 450,000. In the future, Adama plans to educate her children on to the university level. Adama sells quality stock to customers and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more used bags

loans.name: Help We Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very please to present to you members of the “Help We” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Jeneba S. is the leader of this group. Jeneba is 31 years old and married with four children: two in primary school and two in secondary school. 

Jeneba sells palm oil, rice, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc., and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying the aforementioned items in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc., in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman who lives in Talisay City, Cebu.  She earns her living by operating a fish vending business.  Her husband Ramon, who is 46 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who are between the ages of 9 and 23 years old.  

Helen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Helen has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 30,000 PHP, thus increasing the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 4th cycle loan, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital for the fish vending business so that she could continue to save up for the future expansion of her business and the education of her children. Helen is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of fish vending

loans.name: James

texts.en: James N. K. is married and has a two-year-old child. His business is located in Embakasi, in Nairobi, and he is served by the Kitengela branch. He sells shoes at a busy market near the main road. He has been in this business for the last six years and has managed to employ one person. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he faces is the high number of  people doing the same kind of business in the area; customers are not loyal as they are spoilt for choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy more shoes so he can grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He describes himself as an ambitious man.

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman who lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a fish-vending business.  Her husband, 50-year-old Gerardo D., earns a living as a construction worker. They have 4 children who are between 18 and 26 years old. 

Anita  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Anita  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her recent loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 25,000, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000, which she intends to use to purchase more fish to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future, the education of her children, some savings for her family and house repairs. Anita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means “Honorable”). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org and joining our team.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a 44-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 different business ventures: a general store, a car rental service and a fish-vending business. She lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 14,000. 

Nilda is borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she can fund her business operations. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. A recent loan of PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Nilda hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means “Honorable”). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org and joining our team.

loans.use: Funds in business operations

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Camera Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Camera” group.  They are small scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is not the first loan that these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders.  With this new loan, they will further expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Ya Rugie K..  Ya Rugie is age forty-two; she was born in Port Loko town but she is currently residing in Makeni, together with her husband and one child.  Her husband is a teacher and her child is attending primary school.  For eleven years now, Ya Rugie sells food at the market.  With this loan, she will buy palm oil, rice, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc at wholesale to add to her business.

(Attached in the photo is a snap shot of a borrower who was not able to be present for a group photo)

loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc at wholesale to add to her business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 23 años,  convive con Cristian de 24 años. Ambos tienen dos  hijos Yanela y Dana, juntos viven en casa de sus padres. La actividad a la que Rosa es la venta de postres y aperitivos de acuerdo a la temporada en la que se encuentra, en invierno, leche asada y mazamorra, pero en actualmente que es verano, vende jugos, ya sea de naranjas o de otros frutos. Este negocio lo realiza en la puerta de su casa, y desde entonces le va muy, ya que muchos de sus vecinos gustan de estos alimentos que prepara, es más, la buscan los días que descansa. Está emprendedora mujer le gusta todo tipo de ventas, por ello en adelante,  piensa dedicarse también a la compra y venta de carros usados, para apoyar a esposo en los gastos del hogar, puesto  que él se fue a trabajar a una mina. Es el 11avo crédito con MFP, y como socia antigua de su banco comunal se siente agradecido por todo el apoyo que recibe, de la misma forma a sus a todas las personas que hicieron posible en brindarle el crédito. Rosa tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado, en la compra de bandeja de pirex y vasos, asimismo desea comprar repuestos y herramientas para reparar los autos e incursionar en este nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 23, lives with 24 year old Cristian.  They have two children, Yanela and Dana.  They live in her parents’ house.  Rosa sells desserts and aperitifs according to the season.  In winter she sells “leche agria” (a dairy product similar to yogurt) and “mazamorra” (corn porridge).  Now that it is summer she sells juices made from oranges or other fruits.

She carries out her business in the doorway of her house, and it is going very well for her.  Many of her neighbors like the food she makes, and they seek out her food on their days off.  This enterprising woman likes all types of sales.  Later on she plans to also buy and sell used cars.  She will do this to support her husband with the household expenses because he has gone to work in a mine.

This is her 11th loan with MFP.  As a long-time member of her communal bank she is grateful for all of the support that she gets.  She is also grateful to all of the people who made the loan possible.  She plans to use the requested loan to buy a Pyrex tray and glasses.  She also wishes to buy replacement parts and tools to repair cars and venture into this new business.

loans.use: To buy a Pyrex tray and glasses.  She also wishes to buy replacement parts and tools to repair cars and venture into the trade of selling used cars.

loans.name: Noemie

texts.en: Noemie is a 33-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: food vending and trisikad (a pedicab or a bicycle with a rider seat attached on the side) operating. She lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending and trisikad businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). Noemie is borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Noemie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Additional working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de queso, la socia produce y vende los quesos en el mercado de la ciudad de Cusco llamado Huancaro, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de queso. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer queso.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the “Mujeres en Acción” (Women in Action) Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Anta district, Anta province, Cusco department.

Gregoria is 49 years old, single, and has five children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling cheese.  She makes and sells the cheese in the Huancaro market in the city of Cusco.  She works from 7:00 a.m until 4:00 p.m.  She gets her children ahead through this business.  She wants to expand her business of selling cheese.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies to make cheese.  She is very happy about the loan, and she pledges to make all of her payments.

loans.use: To buy supplies to make cheese

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick M. is a married man. They have one child who is 3 months old. His business is located at Mukuru Kwa Njenga in Nairobi and he is served by the Kitengela branch of Kiva partner SMEP. 

He has two businesses; his main business is the barber shop and the other one is a video shop well-known as the Pink Lee movie house. He provides barber services to the local people. He also sells CDs, radio cassettes, VCDs and DVDs. He has been in this business for the last two years and has managed to employ one person. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are so many people doing the same kind of business as his in the area and so customers are not loyal as they are spoiled for choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to renovate his business premises. He hopes to grow his business to be able to improve the living standards of his family. He describes himself as an ambitious and very creative man.

loans.use: Renovating his business premises

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is a married woman who lives in Victorias City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: ready-to-wear clothing, food vending and fish vending. Her husband, Benedicto E. A., is 48 years old years old and works as a farmer to earn his living. They have three children who are between 19 and 23 years old. As of now, one child has a family and two have work to help her. Daisy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 22 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Daisy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 18,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 23rd loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future and put up additional businesses to give a future to her grandchildren. Daisy is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Reunion Group

texts.en:
In this photo are the members of the “Reunion” Group. They are small scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each member of the group from Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, earn a better profit and thereby improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Hassanatu J.. Hassanatu is forty-two years of age. She was born in one of the villages that make up Sanda. However, she currently resides in Makeni with her husband and two children. Her husband works as a driver and her children are in school. One child attends primary school and the other is in secondary school.

Hassanatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells clothing for babies. With her share of this loan, she will further improve her business by buying baby clothes at wholesale to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy baby clothes at wholesale

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a 39 year old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: buying and selling rice grains; working as a rice retailer; and running a food vending business. She lives in E.B. Magalona, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005. She has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000.

Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can purchase more inventory to sell. This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Mary Grace aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva Lending Team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital to purchase goods.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina tiene 48 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su esposo y de sus dos hijos, quienes aún estudian. Desde hace muchos años. Alejandrina se dedica a la venta da chicharrones, sándwich y caldo de gallina en épocas de invierno. Pero,  para la temporada de verano, vende jugos y refrescos de fruta,  acompañado de chicharrones, platillo que gustan mucho a sus clientes, en su mayoría son policías, ya que trabaja cerca de una comisaría. Este negocio lo realiza en la puerta de su casa, durante las mañanas, solo así se genera buenas utilidades con los que puede educar a sus hijos. Se siente muy contenta por el dinamismo de su negocio, aunque a veces termina muy agotada  para el medio día. Esta emprendedora mujer desea en adelante instalar un local, para poder intensificarse en el negocio de la venta de jugos, ya que en su zona carecen de este  negocio. Es el 11avo crédito con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues desea tener mejoras para su negocio. En su banco comunal, es una socia muy responsable y preocupada por el bienestar de su grupo. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará frutas frescas  y renovar sus accesorios de cocina, para brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 48 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her husband and her two children who are still studying.  For a long time, Alejandrina has been selling 'chicharrones' (fried pork rinds), sandwiches and chicken soup during the winter season.  During the summer season, she sells juice and fruit drinks together with 'chicharrones', a dish that is very popular with her customers who are mainly policemen who work in a nearby police station.  Alejandrina carries out her business in the doorway of her home every morning.  She makes good profits which she uses to educate her children.

Alejandrina feels very happy with how dynamic her business is although sometimes she is exhausted by midday.  This enterprising woman would like, in the future, to set up business premises so that she can strengthen her juice sales business as there is a lack of this type of business in her area.

This is Alejandrina's 11th loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time since she would like to keep improving her business.  She is a very responsible member of her community bank who is always concerned for the group's well-being.  She will use this loan to buy fresh fruit and to renew her cooking utensils in order to provide a better service to her customers.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fruit and to renew her cooking utensils

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association DEME du quartier N’tentou de la ville de Ouelessebougou. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans. Mariées et mères d’au moins 2 enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de pagnes et de condiments alimentaires à l’image de BADJEGUE K.. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou dans la préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a une année. Elles sont à leur  2eme  prêt solidaire. 
BADJEGUE K., qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à Ouelessebougou, excelle dans l’achat vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, plusieurs colis de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, concentrée de tomate, oignon, sel, choux, etc.).  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossistes  et vend ses articles à Ouelessebougou et dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité. Les autres membres comptent sur un bénéfice de15.000 FCFA par mois  somme qui leur permettra de rembourser le prêt et de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
BENKADI is a group of the DEME association in the N’tentou neighbourhood of Ouelessebougou.It is made up of four women who met through family ties and neighbourhood connections. They are of an average age of 30 years. All are married and mother to at least 2 children ,they have various activities such as the commerce of traditional dresses and  food seasoning products as does  Badjegue K..They  live in large traditional families in Ouelessebougou in the Kati territory (Koulikoro region, Mali Republic)
They have been working in their small business for some years and are very much in demand.
Hoping to satisfy the increasing needs of their customers, a year ago the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit programme. This is their second loan.
Badjegue K., who is the president of group and very well known in Ouelessebougou, excels in the commerce of condiments. She plans to use her loan to purchase several packets of different sorts of seasoning, (pepper, tomato concentrate, onion, salt, cabbage etc.) She buys her stock in Bamako from wholesalers and sells her produce in Ouelessebougou and at various weekly trade fairs, retail, for cash and credit, to a clientele mostly made up of women.
She hopes to make a monthly profit of 25.000FCFA, an amount which will allow her to reimburse her loan and reinvest in her business. The other group members are expecting a profit of 15.000 FCFA per month which will allow them to repay the loan and provide for their family expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of condiments

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George K. N. is a married man. He and his wife have two children aged fifteen years old and five years old.

His business is located at Kitengela. He provides transport services for local residents. He mainly transports water to the residential houses at his customers' requests. He has been in this business for the last five years. He says that this business is profitable. The major challenge he has is over-coming harrassment from the local government. However, he works hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business running well.

George is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to buy a new engine for his vehicle to enable him to provide better services to his customers. He hopes to grow his business and in the future to diversify into a real estate business. He also sees his business growing so he can earn a monthly income of Kes 30,000. He describes himself as hardworking and customer-friendly.

loans.use: To purchase a new vehicle engine.

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Tamaraneh” Group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are small businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 1,500,000 for each in the group (or SLL 3,000,000 in total). With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, earn more revenue and profit and thereby improve their living conditions.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Saffie J.. Saffie was born in Makeni fifty-five years ago. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a town crier. She has one child in college, and the rest no longer attend school. Saffie has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells palm-oil, margi (used to give sauce as sweet taste), salt, and sugar among other goods. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in large quantities to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy palm-oil, margi, salt, sugar and other goods in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Idalia de 46 años de edad, reside en Santa Elena departamento de Morazán, vive con sus dos hijos de 22 y 23 años de edad, es madre soltera, se dedica a la venta de tamales, este negocio fue por iniciativa propia, debido a la necesidad de trabajar para sus hijos, hoy que sus hijos han crecido le ayudan  con el trabajo, realizándolo todos los días sin tener un horario especifico.
Doña Idalia, quiere dedicarse a una nueva actividad económica y para esto solicita un préstamo y comprar ropa, con idea de obtener más ingresos para su familia, ha planeado dedicarse a vender ropa de forma ambulante, este préstamo le ayudara a iniciar este negocio, e intentar ganarse dinero de otra forma, espera que su objetivo le resulte y que le vaya bien en las ventas.
Sueña con ampliarse en sus negocios, atender la tamalería y el comercio de ropa de la mejor manera, siendo una buena administradora, y obteniendo  mejores ingresos y que su condición económica sea más solvente.
texts.en:
Idalia is 46 years old and lives in Santa Elena, in Morazán department, with her two children aged 22 and 23.  She is a single mother and her business is selling tamales.  She set up this business on her own initiative as she needed to work for her children.  Now that her children have grown they help her in her work every day without observing specific hours.

Idalia would like to start working in a new business activity and this is why she is requesting a loan.  She would like to buy clothes to sell in order to make more income for her family.  She plans to sell her clothes as an itinerant street vendor.  This loan will help her to set up in the business and have another way in which she can to try and make money.  She hopes that she will achieve her goal and that her sales will go well.

Idalia dreams of expanding both her businesses, serving in her tamale restaurant and selling her clothes in the best way possible.  She dreams of being a good businesswoman, of obtaining better profits and of her financial situation becoming more solvent.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Africana

texts.en:
Africana is a married woman who lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: food vending (barbeque); and buying and selling frozen products. Her husband Ernesto J., who is 45 years old, works as a multi-cab driver to earn his living. They have 4 children who are 5 to 22 years old.

Africana joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Africana has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her to earn a monthly profit of PHP 24,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to purchase more goods to sell so that she can continue to save for the future. Her priorities are to educate her children and to repair their house. Africana is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva Lending Team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dana

texts.es: La Sr. Dana Vive en el municipio de la guardia,  es nacida en el departamento del  Beni, capital ganadera de Bolivia, su esposo con el cual tiene un hijo trabaja como guardia de seguridad,  ella hace unos 12 año que se dedica a la venta de ropa, de forma ambulante; el destino del crédito es para terminar de cancelar un lote de terreno, donde mas adelante construirán su domicilio,  ya que este es su deseo ver su casita terminada, es un apersona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Dana lives in the municipality of La Guardia and was born in the department of Beni, the cattle-raising capital of Bolivia.  Her husband, with whom she has a son, works as a security guard.  Dana has for some 12 years now been dedicated to selling clothes in the streets.

The loan is to finish paying for an urban lot where, later, they will build their home.  It is their desire to see their house finished.  Dana is a very hard-working person and she has agreed with the institution's terms for the help it is offering.

loans.use: TO PAY OFF AN URBAN LOT ON WHICH TO BUILD THEIR HOME

loans.name: Orquidia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Orquídea es mujer comerciante, madre de dos hijos, cuenta con su propio negocio una pulpería que ha crecido gracias al esfuerzo y financiamiento que la institución ha dado, en donde ha aumentado su inventario y sus niveles de ventas.
Inicio  con fondos propios, con liquidación de su trabajo, a si mismo con el apoyo económico de su esposo, quien labora como cadete de taxi.
Con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en productos de consumo como: quintales de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, bidón de aceite, caja de jabón, cereales, golosinas, productos lácteos, pollo y otros productos que sastifagan al cliente. Siendo el objetivo vender para poder cubrir sus gastos básicos, como sus compromisos de pago.
texts.en:
Orquídea is a business woman, and mother of two children, she has her own business - a local store - which has grown thanks to the effort and financing that the institution has given, and where she has increased her stock and her sales levels.
She started with her own funds, with the sale of her own business, and with the financial support of her husband who works as a taxi driver.
With this new loan she will invest in consumer products like: kilos of rice, beans, sugar, corn, cans of oil, cakes of soap, cereals, candy, milk products,chicken and other products that the customers need. The objective being to make sales to be able to cover her basic costs, like her payment obligations.

loans.use: She will buy consumer products to increase her sales levels

loans.name: Ma. Glendel

texts.en:
Ma. Glendel is a 42 year old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: transport (Multicab), cake making and rag making businesses. She lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her transport (Multicab), cake making and rag making businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 40,000. Ma. Glendel is borrowing PHP 22,000 so that she could fund her business operations.  This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Glendel aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.   

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Repair and additional working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Benso Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENSO  (4 femmes mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU, un des quartiers de la ville de OUELESSEBOUGOU (2ème région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur neuvième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers : encens, pagnes, cosmétiques  et la petite restauration (avec les friandises, les fritures de pâtes de céréales).  MARIAM B., la présidente du groupe fait l’achat et la vente de pagnes wax et teintés.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 40 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de BAMAKO auprès des grossistes.
Les pagnes sont vendus au  marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU et à domicile, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the BENSO group (four married women) are, on average, 35 years old and have four children. They live in traditional families in N’tentou, a district of the city of Ouelessebougou (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They are on their ninth joint loan with the microfinance institution Yiriwaso because they want to be able to meet the demands of their clientele. This group of women deals in various articles: incense, pagnes (brightly colored cloth used for clothing) cosmetics, and light food service (sweets, fried foods). Mariam B., the leader of the group, buys and sells Wax and tinted pagnes. 

With her loan, she plans to buy 40 Wax pagnes. She gets her supplies at the main market in Bamako from wholesalers. The pagnes are sold at the market at Ouelessebougou and door to door, to a clientele of men and women, at retail for cash and on credit.

She foresees making an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA, a part of which will be used to help her husband with daily expenses and the rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes

loans.name: Active Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very please to present to you members of the “Active” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of SLL 1,000,000.00 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Kadiatu S. is the leader of this group. Kadiatu is forty-year-old, married with five children – two in primary school school and three in secondary school. Kadiatu sells market food – palm-oil, rice, onions, beans, etc. and has been running this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Kadiatu will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: Buys palm-oil, rice, onions, beans, etc. in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a 54-year old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: general store, buy and sell of charcoal and woods and rice vending businesses. She lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, buying and selling of charcoal and woods and rice vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 50,000. Carmen is borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she could fund her business operations. This will be her 6th  loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Carmen aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Funds in business operation

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 femmes du groupe Danaya ont en moyenne 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des  familles nucléaires, à Ouelessebougou ville, préfecture de Kati, relevant de Koulikoro (2ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de cosmétiques, de fournitures scolaires, d’hatits à l’image de AMINATA D. etc.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, trois douzaines de parfums,  deux douzaines de pommades, crèmes et des vernis pour les ongles. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Ouelessebougou et  effectue sa vente, au  marché de Ouelessebougou, en ambulant dans les quartiers et structures professionnelles et à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the Danaya group average 38 years of age with four children each, and they all live in nuclear families in Ouelessebougou town, in the prefecture of Kati, linked to Koulikoro (Mali's second administrative region). 

They are on their first loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with an aim of satisfying their customers' needs. This group of ladies trades in cosmetics, school materials, clothes, as is the case for Aminata D., etc. With her loan she is planning on buying three dozen perfumes, two dozen ointments, creams and nail varnish. She gets her supplies at the large market in Ouelessbougou and sells them at the same market, but also walking around the various districts and professional establishments and at home, to a customer base made up of men and women, on a retail basis, for cash and on credit. She is planning to make an average monthly profit of 20,000FCFA, of which part will be used to help her husband with the daily expenses and the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fruits

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: La Sra.  Elvira  esta casada, con dos  hijos, tiene ya 2 años dedicándose a la venta de material escolar en el mismo lugar donde se encuentra su domicilio, vive en casa de sus suegros desde hace 5 años. La Sra.  Elvira también tiene en su local un teléfono público que atiende todos los días al igual que su fotocopiadora que le falta algunos repuestos para ponerla a funcionar nuevamente. Doña Elvira se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a la demanda que se le  presenta mayormente en estas épocas del año ya que pronto empezaran las labores escolares, con el dinero del crédito comprara  Material Escolar(Cuadernos, hojas bon, bolígrafos, lápices, carpicolas, tajadores, mercadería para surtir su negocio) y arreglo de fotocopiadora, es cliente nueva de la institución y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Elvira is married and has two children.  For two years, she has been in business selling school supplies from her home.  She has lived in her in-laws' home for 5 years.

Elvira has a public telephone on her premises that she provides service with every day, as well as a photocopier that needs some repairs as it is not working right now.  Elvira had to request a loan from our institution because she has a lot of demand at this particular time of year as the school year is due to begin shortly.  Elvira will use her loan money to buy school supplies: exercise books, paper, pens, pencils, glue, pencil sharpeners and other merchandise for her business.  She will also use some of the loan money to have her photocopier repaired.

Elvira is a new client of our institution and she is grateful for the support that she has been offered.

loans.use: To buy school supplies: exercise books, paper, pens, pencils, glue, pencil sharpeners and other merchandise to stock her business.  To have her photocopier repaired

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Lolo est un regroupement de 4 femmes ayant en moyenne 32  ans, 3 enfants et vivant  dans des familles nucléaires à Filabougou, un des quartiers de la ville Ouelessebougou de Koulikoro (2ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de pagnes avec BAOU G., d’habits pour enfants et des produits alimentaires.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  12 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Ellle effectue sa vente au  marché de Ouelessebougou et à domicile à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000.FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Lolo is a group of 4 women who are, on average, 32 years old, have three children, and live in nuclear families in Filabougou, a district in the city of Ouelessebougou, in Koulikoro, (2nd administrative region of Mali).

They are on their first joint loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso because they want to be able to meet the demands of their clientele.  This group of women sells pagnes (lengths of brightly colored cloth used for clothing), children’s clothing, and food products, as does Baou G..

With her loan, she plans to buy 12 Wax pagnes.  She gets her supplies at the main market in Bamako, the capital of Mali, from wholesalers.  She makes her sales at retail at the market in Ouelessebougou and door to door to a clientele made up mostly of women, for cash and on credit. 

She foresees making an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, a part of which will be used to help her husband with daily expenses and the rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy Wax pagnes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more baby blanket, powder and soap

loans.name: Jose Bitelio

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, vive con su familia esposa y dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, ellos residen en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, el negocio comenzó por el apoyo de su padre, quien le enseño el cuidado que necesita la crianza de los cerdos, esto le ha permitido tener experiencia en su granja.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar cerdos, con este préstamo aumentara su número de cerdos en la granja de los cuales engordara para luego venderlos.
Esta compra le ayudara a ampliar el negocio, incrementándole la oportunidad de ganar más ingresos y ampliar la granja, mejorando así las condiciones de su negocio y la de su familia.
Sueña en ser una gran comerciante de cerdos, aportar para su familia todo lo necesario y velar por el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and two children, aged 5 and 2, in San Rafael Oriente, in San Miguel department.  His business is raising pigs.  He started his business with the support of his father who taught him how to care for the pigs he would raise.  This gave him experience on his farm.

José is currently requesting a loan to buy pigs.  He will use the loan to increase the number of pigs on his farm which he will fatten and then sell.  This purchase will help him to expand his business and increase his opportunity to make more income.  This will improve his business and improve his family's living conditions.

José dreams of becoming a large-scale pig salesman, providing his family with everything they need and looking out for his children's well-being.

loans.use: To buy pigs

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah K. is thirty one years old and married. The husband is a sales man with a local company and they have two children aged eight years old and three and half years old. Her business is located at Pipeline and is well known by the name Kongowea Ndogo. She is served by the Kitengela branch. She owns a general store in which sells such items as detergents, beverages and others. Besides this business she sells groceries to the local people. She has been in this business for the last four years and has managed to provide employment to two people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is there are so many people doing the same kind of business as hers in the area and so customers are not loyal as they are spoiled with choices. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to restock her shop to meet the demands of her customers. She sees herself buying land and building her own house some day. She describes herself as aggressive and ambitious.

loans.use: Beverages, detergents and vegetables

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vilma es una mujer con un pequeño negocio, iniciando hace un año con una pequeña pulpería que ha venido mejorando con los financiamientos que Afodenic ha dado.
Hoy en día cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien labora como asesor administrativo, y que junto se han esforzado para dar lo mejor a sus dos hijos.
Con este nuevo  préstamo, comprara: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, caja de jabón, bidón de aceite, golosinas, carne, pollo, queso, así como ropa interior para comenzar a tener mejores resultados de ventas.
texts.en:
Vilma is a small business owner.  She started out a year ago with a small grocery store that she’s been gradually improving with the loans Afodenic has given her.

Today she relies on her husband’s support who works as an Administrative Advisor; together they have striven to provide the best for their two children.

With this new loan she will buy: rice, beans, sugar, a case of soap, a large jug of oil, snacks, meat, chicken, cheese as well as underwear to start having better sales results.

loans.use: She will buy basic grains, rice, beans, sugar, corn, soap and snacks thus achieving sales increases and growth of her small business.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
El señor Justo vive en casa familiar con su esposa en la zona alto san Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, la actividad que realiza es la reparación de motores de autos, electrodomésticos,  etc. Tiene un taxi con el cual trabaja en transporte publico, esta casado tiene una hija que actualmente vive con el y su esposa, hace un mes atrás alquilo un taller de reparacion de motores y otros.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar herramientas e instalar mejor el taller porque tiene ya muchos clientes, y de esta manera conservar esta otra fuente de ingresos estable

Es cliente de impro, paga muy bien y por el carácter social puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Justo lives in his family home with his wife in the community of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz.  He repairs automobile motors, electrical household appliances, etc.  He also owns a taxi and provides public transportation.  He is married and his daughter is currently living with him and his wife.  One month ago, he rented a motor repair shop.

He will use the loan to buy tools and better equip the repair shop because he already has many customers and this will enable him maintain this other source of stable income. He is a client of Impro who pays on time and qualifies to be approved for the loan.
.

loans.use: compra de herramientas para installar su taller en mejores condiciones. To buy tools to improve conditions in his repair shop.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: Adriana, de 56 años, es separada de su esposo, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus dos hijas mayores y que son independientes. Adriana, se dedica a la confección de blusas, camisas, pantalones, buzos, polos  y sábanas, prendas que son vendidas en diversos mercados de su zona. Asimismo elabora bocaditos y platillos especiales, que son preparados para algún evento que se presente, ya que una de sus mayores características es la de ser una experta cocinera. Pero la actividad que más disfruta es la de confeccionar prendas, ante esto ha logrado captar muchos clientes,  y ellos no dudan en requerir de sus servicios.  Lleva 30 años en esta labor que tanto le apasiona, sin embargo sabe que debe aumentar sus ingresos, por ello debe intensificarse en la venta de alimentos, es así que se ha propuesto instalar una fuente de soda en su casa. Es el segundo crédito con MFP,  y sabe que este aporte le será de mucha utilidad para el desarrollo de su negocio, por ello se compromete pagar sus cuotas sin ningún retraso. De obtener el crédito, comprará telas en cantidades, para confeccionar polos  y short, de esa manera lograr abastecer los pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Adriana is 56 years old.  She is separated from her husband and lives in her own home with her two independent, adult daughters.  Adriana, makes blouses, shirts pants, sweatshirts, polo shirts, and sheets. She sells these garments at several markets in her region.  Likewise, she makes snacks and special dishes for events since one of her best attributes is being an expert cook.  But the activity she enjoys the most is making clothing.  Before, she managed to attract many customers and they didn’t hesitate to request her services.  

She has spent 30 years in this work that is her passion. However, she knows that she must increase her income.  For this reason, she must increase food sales. So she has proposed to install a soda fountain in her house.  

This is her second loan with MFP, and she knows that this support will be very useful for the development of her business.  For this reason, she promises to make her payments without delay.  She will use the loan to buy material in bulk, to make polo shirts and shorts and in this way, fill her pending orders.

loans.use: To buy material to make polo shirts and shorts.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es: El Sr. Simón, vive en la cuidad de Santa Cruz-Bolivia por la zona de los lotes, vive en casa familiar con su esposa y sus cuatros hijos. El Sr. Simón tiene la actividad de pintor albañil, el cual actualmente se encuentra realizando el pintado de un inmueble por, el préstamo solicitado será destinado en la compra de materiales para realizar su trabajo, el mismo que quiere comprar (6 Valdés de pinturas, pigmentos, barniz); ya que esta recibiendo bastantes solicitudes de trabajos, su objetivo es seguir trabajando para poder llegar a comprarse su lote y construir su propia casita, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Simon lives in the “Lotes” region of Santa Cruz, Bolivia.  He lives in the family home with his wife and four children.  He works as a painter and bricklayer.  Currently, he is painting a building.  The purpose of the loan is to buy materials (6 paint buckets, paint, and varnish) to do his work.  Since he is receiving enough work orders, his goal is to continue working in order to be able to buy his plot of land and build his own home. He is a hard-working person and he is grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: To buy materials (6 paint buckets, paint, and varnish)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, meat, fish, onions, tomato, pepper, salt, seasonings etc

loans.name: La Loma Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama "L. Loma", esta ubicado en L. comunidad D. Palmillas, Sn Felipe del Progreso, L. comunidad actualmente cuenta con todos los servicios publicos, antes era lo mas cercano a un rancho pero poco a poco ha ido creciendo y ahora cuenta con todo los servicios publicos y encementados, L. gente y sus costumbres es lo unico que no cambian, L. gente se dedica a criar sus animales y otras más a el comercio general, todos los niños tienen acceso facil a L. educación para que tengan un mejor porvenir, por eso todos estan estudiando y sus padres se preocupan más por L. eduación D. los niños que antes. Los integrantes del grupo "L. Loma" son 8, 6 mujeres y 2 hombres, se pusieron "L. Loma" porqué son vecinos cercanos y viven en a lomita D. un cerro en su localidad, todos son comerciantes con diferentes actividades, sus nombres son los siguientes: 
1.-Jilia C. R., tiene 52 años D. edad
2.-MarceL. G. L., tiene 36 años
3.-Belem L. D. L. L., tiene 28 años
4.-Bertha C. T., tiene 28 años
5.-Maria Andrea R. C., tiene 21 años
6.-Margarita D. L. C. F., tiene 30 años
7.-Roberto H. C., tiene 34 años
8.-Ruben G. R., tiene 22 años
L. lider del grupo es L. señora Bertha, tiene 28 años y es casada por el civil desD. hace 9 años, L. señora vive con su esposo en una casa propia, tiene 2 niñas que van a al escueL. estudian L. primaria, el señor trabaja en un mercado en el centro del pueblo D. San Felipe vendiendo frutas y verduras, L. señora para poder ayudar a su esposo venD. ropa D. niña, ropa interior calcetas y calcetines para los niños, venD. en L. misma comunidad donD. vive en Palmillas, lo hace afuera D. L. escueL. D. sus hijas, ahi pone un hule en el piso para poner encima L. mercancía y empezar a vender, Doña Bertha nos platica que lo dificil es que tiene que fiar L. ropa porqué L. gente le dice que no tiene dinero para pagarle enseguida por eso L. da en pagos para poder vender, con lo poco que gana porqué nos dice que no es mucho le ayuda con L. comida a su esposo para sus hijas que se llevan algo para el desayuno y llegando a su casa coman bien, una meta es que pueda tener un local en el centro para poder vender bien y estar mejor economicamente, doña Bertha quiere que con el tiempo le vaya mejor y buscar su propio local.
texts.en:
The following group is called "L. Loma" (HillsiD.) and is located in Palmillas community, in San Felipe del Progreso.  The community currently has access to all public services but, in the past, it didn't.  However, it has gradually grown over time and the inhabitants now have access to public services and cement structures.  The people and their customs are the only things that haven't changed.

Some of the people in the community work raising animals and others work in commerce.  All of the children have easy access to education so that they can enjoy a better future.  They are all studying and their parents are more concerned about them getting an education than they were in the past.

There are 8 members in the "L. Loma" group: 6 women and 2 men.  They gave their group the name "L. Loma" because they are all close neighbors and they live on the same hillsiD..  All of the group's members are engaged in commerce and sell different products.  Their names are as follows:
1.-Jilia C. R. - 52 years old
2.-MarceL. G. L. - 36 years old
3.-Belem L. D. L. L. - 28 years old
4.-Bertha C. T. - 28 years old
5.-Maria Andrea R. C. - 21 years old
6.-Margarita D. L. C. F. - 30 years old
7.-Roberto H. C. - 34 years old
8.-Ruben G. R. - 22 years old

The leader of this group is Bertha.  She is 28 years old and has been married for 9 years.  She lives with her husband in her own home.  She has two daughters who are in elementary school.  Bertha's husband works in a market in the center of San Felipe, selling fruit and vegetables.  In order to help her husband, Bertha sells children's clothes and children's underwear (underpants and socks).  She sells her products in her own community of Palmillas.  She sets up outsiD. her daughters' school, laying down a cloth on the ground so that she can set out her merchandise and start making her sales.

Bertha tells us that the most difficult part of her work is that she has to proviD. her clothes on credit because people tell her that they don't have enough money to pay her straight away.  For this reason, she sells her products and collects payment in instalments so that she is able to make her sales.  She uses the small amount of money that she makes (she tells us that it isn't much) to help her husband pay for food for their daughters, so that they have something to take to school for breakfast and so that they can eat well when they get home.  One of Bertha's goals is to acquire business premises in the center of town where she can better sell her clothes and she would also like to improve her financial situation.  Bertha would like, over time, for her business to do better and she would like to find her own business premises.

loans.use: To buy children's underwear (underpants and socks)

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 52 años, es un hombre jovial y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijas de los 6 que son en total. A lo largo de toda su vida, Carlos ha trabajado en diferentes oficios, pero lo que más le gusta y tiene domino es la albañilería. Desde entonces construye casas así como también realiza los acabados correspondientes, por lo que sus clientes quedan satisfechos por su trabajo. las personas que saben de su trabajo; le recomienda a otros interesados, siendo así que Carlos, es muy solicitado por sus obras realizadas: E la actualidad trabaja a lado de su hijo, quien la apoya, contratando a los obreros que terminarán de hacer el vaciado del techo o realicen cimientos. Lleva trabajando 35 años en esta labor y espera en el futuro, conformar una empresa constructora en sociedad con su hijo, de ese modo podrá mejorar su calida de vida. Es el 12avo crédito con MFP, por lo que espera no retrazarse en sus cuotas, asimismo es muy respetuosa con las socias de su banco comunal. De obtener el crédito solicitado, comprará madera, material que necesita para la construcción de viviendas.
texts.en:
Carlos, aged 52, is a jovial and hard-working man who lives in his own house with his wife and 4 of their 6 children. Throughout his life, Carlos has worked in different trades, but what he likes most and has mastered is cement masonry. Since he took that up he has built houses and done the finish work on them. His customers have been very satisfied with his work. Those who know his work recommend him to other interested persons. As a result, Carlos is much in demand, based on his past efforts.

Currently, he works alongside his son who helps out, contracting workers to build the roof structure or do the cementing. Carlos has been working for 35 years in this trade and he hopes that in the future, he and his son can start a construction enterprise together, thus improving their standard of living.

This is his 12th loan with MFP and he so he knows he won't fall behind in his payments. Moreover, he is very respectful towards his fellow communal bank members. With this loan, Carlos will buy wood, materials that are necessary in house construction.

loans.use: TO BUY WOOD FOR HIS HOME CONSTRUCTION BUSINESS

loans.name: Cuanicuti Group

texts.es:
La señora Fabiola B. L., es parte del grupo “CUANICUTI” comentan que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo por que donde vive ella los condominios tienen ese nombre y ahí harán sus reuniones semanalmente y que esta muy orgullosa de pertenecer a este grupo porque ella es la representante de este. Doña Fabiola es originaria de Naucalpan de Juárez en el Estado de México pero desde hace 20 años se vino a vivir con sus papas a la población de Zitacuaro Michoacán por cuestiones familiares. Ella cuenta con 30 años de edad, estudio la carrera técnica de trabajo social, y comenta que ya no laboro en su profesión por que se caso y decidió dedicarse a su hogar. Doña Fabi como le dicen sus amigos y familiares se dedica a vender productos por catalogo y también tiene el puesto de coordinador de ventas en la empresa de cosméticos, dice que tiene con esta actividad hace mas de 4 años, y que empezó a vender los productos por catalogo porque desde muy pequeña le ayudaba a su mama a vender los productos por catalogo. También le ayuda a su esposo a vender y a dar mantenimiento a copiadoras, también vende cartuchos para las copiadoras, tóner y papelería,  dice que con el negocio de las copiadoras tiene aproximadamente 10 años, y que su esposo fue que le enseño este tipo de negocio. La señora Fabiola, está casada con el señor Uriel, el se dedica a la venta y reparación de copiadoras y tienen su negocio en su casa aunque es muy chica dice que se ahorran la renta de un local, ellos tienen una hija de nombre Melanie la cual tiene 8 años de edad y estudia la primaria. Dice la señora Fabiola que su meta en la vida es poder hacer un local estable donde pueda vender sus cosméticos y las demás cosas que vende por catalogo, y también poner el negocio de las copiadoras. Comenta que con las ganancias que saque de vender sus productos por catalogo y de la venta de copiadoras ahorrara para comprar un terreno para hacer el local que tanto sueña.

Blanca Estela C. M., es parte del grupo “CUANICUTI” tiene 54 años y estudio hasta el sexto año de primaria comenta que no siguió estudiando porque sus papas ya no la siguieron apoyando ya que antes los papas decían que las mujeres no tenían que estudiar porque ellas se casaban y ya no les serbia el estudio. Doña Blanca está casada con el señor Miguel él cual se dedica a reparar línea Blanca ellos tuvieron 6 hijos todos ya casados. Doña Blanca se dedica a vender ropa usada en la central de abastos de Zitacuaro, ella tiene un puesto desde hace aproximadamente 8 años, y decidió emprender este negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del médico que ella necesitaba ya que padeció la menopausia, y tenía que comprar medicamentos muy caros y por eso también ella se puso a trabajar, dice que anteriormente ella era costurera y que hacia vestidos de novia, de quinceañera y vestidos de noche, pero que desgraciadamente la enfermedad que padece perdió poco a poco su vista y ya no continuo cosiendo. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora se levanta a diario a las 6 de la mañana para ir a vender su ropa y los días jueves se va más temprano para apartar un lugar en el tianguis de la población. Ella compra sus pacas de ropa usada en Toluca estado de México. Doña Blanca está solicitando su préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa usada y ella pretende comprar zapatos usados para vender en su puesto, y la meta que ella tiene para su negocio es ahorrar para rentar un local donde pueda tener más ropa y bien surtido e incrementar el número de clientas que ella tiene.

Los otros 8 integrantes se llaman Manuel Humberto O. C., Judith López García, Decire Marín P., Minerva Rúelas C., Melina López Colín, Nadia Iveth López G. ellos quieren los préstamos para invertir en  la compra de productos y cosméticos por catalogo, venta de ropa, venta de antojitos mexicanos, en repostería etc.
texts.en:
Señora Fabiola B. L. is a member of the group "CUANICUTI".  They named their group after some condominiums in their area and this is where they will hold their weekly meetings.  She is very proud to be a member of this group as she is the representative.  Doña Fabiola is originally from Naucalpan de Juárez in Mexico state.  Because of family matters, she came with her parents to live in Zitacuaro Michoacán 20 years ago.  She is 30 years old and studied social work.  She says that she is not working in her professional field because she got married and decided to dedicate her time to her family.  Doña Fabi, as her friends and family call her, sells catalog products and also works as a sales coordinator for a cosmetics company.  She has worked at this job for more than 4 years.   She started selling catalog products because, when she was a young girl, she used to help her mother sell catalog products.  She also helps her husband sell and maintain copiers as well as selling copier cartridges, toner and stationary.  She says that she has approximately 10 years of experience in the copier business and that her husband, Señor Uriel, was the one who taught her this business.  He runs this small business out of their home, saving on rent. They have a daughter named Melanie who is 8 years old and attends elementary school.  Señora Fabiola says that her goal is to have a fixed location where she can sell cosmetics and other catalog products and move the copier business there.    She says that she will save the earnings from her catalog and copier sales to purchase a piece of land where she can have the commercial site that she dreams of. 

Blanca Estela C. M. is another member of the group "CUANICUTI" and is 54 years old.  She finished school until 6th grade and says that she could not continue her studies because her parents couldn't continue supporting her.   Her parents said that women didn't have to go to school because they would just get married and an education would be no use.  Doña Blanca is married to Señor Miguel who works as a line repairman.  They had 6 children and they are all now married.  Doña Blanca sells used clothing at the supply center in Zitacuaro.  She has had a stand there for about 8 years now.  She decided to start this business as a way to help her husband with her medical expenses because she was suffering from menopause and had to purchase expensive medication.  She used to work as a seamstress.  She made wedding dresses, quinceañera dresses and evening gowns, but, unfortunately, her illness caused her to slowly lose her sight and she couldn't continue sewing.  She is a very hard-working person.  She gets up at 6 am every day to go to work in Toluca in Mexico state to sell her clothing and every Thursday she leaves even earlier to get a spot in the open air market in town.  In Toluca, she buys large quantities of used clothing.  Doña Blanca is requesting a loan to purchase used clothing and she also plans to buy used shoes to sell at her stand.  Her goal is to save enough money to rent a commercial site for her business she can increase her stock and her customer base.  

The other 8 members of the group are Manuel Humberto O. C., Judith López García, Decire Marín P., Minerva Rúelas C., Melina López Colín and Nadia Iveth López G..  They are all requesting loans to invest in their various businesses including cosmetic and catalog sales, clothing sales, Mexican snack sales, confectionery shop, etc.

loans.use: To invest in cosmetic and catalog products ,Mexican snack sales, clothing sales and a confectionery shop

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es:
Esta unidad D. desarrollo se llama El Carmen porque es el nombre que tiene su comunidad. Las UDEs son grupos D. mas D. 10 personas que tienen una cuenta en el banco y se reunen cada ocho o quince dias para realizar sus pagos. Tienen un representante y un comite que lo gobierna. Este grupo esta ubicado en L. comunidad del carmen que pertenece al municipio D. San Miguel Soyaltepec en el estado D. oaxaca. Este grupo esta conformado por diez personas que se conocen desD. hace muchos años por que son vecionos en L. comunidad.

El representante del grupo se llama Judith D. T., tiene 25 años D. edad, es soltera y actualmente estudia L. carrera D. derecho. ElL. desD. hace mas D. cinco años decidio iniciar con su propio negocio D. venta D. pollos azados y tacos porque elL. queria poder pagar sus estudios, elL. venD. desD. el corredor D. su casa, el miercoles y el domingo venD. pollos apartir D. las dos D. L. tarD. y los fines D. semana (jueves, viernes y sabado) venD. tacos por L. noche. Judith necesita este credito para invertirlo en L. compra D. pollos, variedad D. chiles, carbon, carne, especies, aceite, tortillas, tomates, cebolL., desechables, y refrescos para preparar su comida y posteriormente venderL., elL. espera que esta inversion le deje buenas ganancias para seguir invirtiendo y poder continuar con sus estudios.	
	
Norma R. G. es parte del grupo El Carmen, elL. tiene 37 años solo estudio primaria y esta casada con el señor JOse Antonio Ruiz con el cual tiene cuatro hijos  D. los cuales uno es hombre D. nombre David tiene 16 años y asiste a L. preparatoria y 3 mujeres D. nombres Jaquelin D. 13 años que estudia L. secundaria,  berenice D. 11 años que estudia L. primaria y las mas pequeña mia D. 5 años y asiste al prescolar D. L. comunidad. Doña norma desD. hace mas D. 2 años tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su hogar llamada Abarrotes Bere L. cual esta pintada D. un color anaranjado, elL. decidio iniciar con su propio negocio porque queria ayudar a a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios D. sus hijos, necesita este prestamo para invertirlo en L. compra D. arroz, maiz, frijol, aceite, jabon y queso para resurtir su tiendita, tambien nos dijo que esta aprendiendo reposteria porque en un futuro desea agrandar su negocio y vender tambien pasteles. Doña norma espera seguir invirtiendo sus ganancias en su negocio y L. educacion D. sus hijos ya que desea darles una mejor clidad D. vida.

los otros ocho integrantes son:

Lucia C. T. - taqueria 
Nora C. P. - antojitos mexicanos
Antonia T. D. L. C. - polleria
Margarito T. A. - cultivo D. maiz 
CiriL. C. C. - antojitos mexicanos
Blanca Rosa D. H. - polleria
Modesta O. R. - panaderia
Celsa M. R. - cosmeticos
texts.en:
This development unit is called El Carmen because that’s the name of their community.  Development Units are groups of more than 10 people who have an account in the bank and meet every week or two weeks to make their payments.  They have a representative and a governing committee.  This group is located in the El Carmen community which is part of the municipality of San Miguel Soyaltepec in the state of Oaxaca.  The group is maD. up of ten people who have known each other for many years because they are neighbors in the community.

The group representative is Judith D. T..  She is 25 years old, single and is studying Law.  She decided over five years ago to start her own roasted chicken and taco sales business because she wanted to pay for her studies.  She sells from her yard at home.  On Wednesdays and Sundays she sells chicken starting at two in the afternoon and on weekends (Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays) she sells tacos at night.  Judith needs this loan to buy chickens, a variety of chilies, charcoal, meat, spices, oil, tortillas, tomatoes, onions, disposables and beverages to prepare her food for subsequent sale.  She hopes this investment will produce good earnings to continue investing and be able to continue with her studies.

Norma R. G. is part of the El Carmen group.  She is 37 years old and only went to elementary school.  She’s married to José Antonio Ruiz with whom she has four children.  One is a boy, David.  He’s 16 years old and goes to high school.  The three girls are Jaquelin, 13, who is in middle school, Berenice, 11, who is in elementary school and the youngest, Mia, who is five and goes to the local preschool.

For the last two years Norma has had a grocery store in her home called Abarrotes Bere which is painted orange.  She decided to start her own business because she wanted to help her husband with household expenses and with the children’s educational costs.   She needs this loan to buy rice, corn, beans, oil, soap and cheese to stock her little store.  She also told us that she’s learning pastry making because in the future she’d like to expand her business and also sell cakes.  Norma hopes to continue to invest her profits in her business and in her children’s education since she’d like proviD. them with a better quality of life.

The other eight members are:

Lucia C. T. – taco stand
Nora C. P. – Mexican fast food
Antonia T. D. L. C. – chicken shop
Margarito T. A. – corn farmer 
CiriL. C. C. - Mexican fast food
Blanca Rosa D. H. - chicken shop 
Modesta O. R. – bakery
Celsa M. R. - cosmetics

loans.use: For fast food sales, tacos, chicken, bread, corn, groceries and cosmetics.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria R.
