Sandra M. O. lives in Huitzililla, in Ciudad Ayala, in the State of Morelos, Mexico.  She is 27 years old and studied up to the third year of high school.  She has her diploma.  

Sandra is married and has one son called Miguel Ángel who is 3 years old.  She sells shoes and bedspreads through a catalog.  Sandra has requested her loan to buy shoes and bedspreads in order to fill her orders.  She offers her customers women's, men's and children's shoes, and bedspreads, through a catalog.  Her customers are girls who buy shoes and ladies who buy bedspreads.

Sandra started her business three years ago in Cuautla.  When she moved, they offered for her to make catalog sales.  She was enthusiastic and ordered her catalogs in order to start making sales.  Sandra goes from house to house offering her products for sale.  Her husband gave her the money to start her business.  Her husband was working in the US but he has since come home and is working in the countryside.

Sandra's business is important because she has been making a profit in it.  She likes it when she visits her customers and they buy her products.  She is proud because, thanks to God, she has money.  The challenges that she faces in her business are high costs and competition.  There are many other women and girls who make catalog sales.

Sandra uses the profits that she makes in her business to buy more shoes and bedspreads and to cover her expenses.  Sandra lives with her parents.  Her business has helped her family.  Sandra does her work for her household, to cover household expenses.  She would like to make some improvements to her home, buying windows and glass.  Her plans and hopes are to improve her business and to continue living in her home with her parents.  She is very happy to be receiving this loan.  Her wish for her son's future is for him to study.  This loan will help her to continue working and to continue selling so that he doesn't want for anything.

Huitzililla is a very quiet village.  It is close to the countryside where people grow beans, corn, onions and green beans.  Sandra would like to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad "Thank you for the loan.  I will not let you down.  I will continue to pay back my loans so that you will lend me more in the future".

loans.use: To buy women's and children's shoes, and bedspreads, to stock her business

loans.name: Xochitl

texts.es: La señora Xochitl R. Vázquez está ubicada en la comunidad de Huitzililla, Cd. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos México, ella tiene 32 años de edad, estudio hasta el 3er. Año de secundaria tiene su certificado, ella vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijas Vanessa de 10 años de edad está estudiando el 5º. Año de primaria, Mariela tiene 4 años de edad está en el Kínder, ella vende producto Amway, colchas y zapatos por catalogo y solicito su préstamo para comprar productos Amway, colchas, zapatos y para poner la instalación de la luz a su casa va a comprar cable, soque, apagadores y para pagar la mano de obra.  Ella ofrece a sus clientes colchas, zapatos y productos ama como jabón, detergente, shampoo, vitaminas, nutrientes para el cuerpo, cremas etc.  Ella inicio con el negocio hace 5 años una amiga la invito y le recomendó ir a capacitación con un crédito que adquirió pago su pedido. Ella sale a ofrecer sus productos va de casa en casa caminando. Antes de este negocio vendía comida tacos de arroz, picaditas, dobladas, tlacoyos. Su negocio es importante porque tiene dinero extra, porque le va bien en este negocio se vende muy bien, sus clientes son sus amigas, maestras. Ella quiere ampliar su negocio meter más producto y lo piensa lograr reinvirtiendo las ganancias y sacando otro crédito, su hija Vanessa le ayuda en el negocio lleva los catálogos a la escuela y vende con sus maestros. Su negocio le va a ayudar a su familia a tener más ingresos, las mejorías que desea hacer a su vivienda son poner la luz, el piso de loseta y el baño, sus planes y esperanzas para el futuro es tener negocios y dinero que sus hijas sigan estudiando y este préstamo le va a ayudar a que estén bien económicamente. La señora Xochitl quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les doy las gracias por sus créditos que me están haciendo ya que es el mejor porcentaje de interés”.
texts.en: Mrs. Xochitl R. Vázquez lives in the community of Huitzililla, Ayala city, in the state of Morelos México. She is 32 years old and finished the 3rd year of middle school; she has her certificate. She lives in a common law marriage and has 2 daughters. Vanessa,10 years old, is in the 5th grade of primary school. Mariela is 4 years old and in kindergarten. She sells Amway, blankets and shoes via catalogue. She asked for her loan to buy Amway products, blankets, shoes and to install electricity in her house. She is going to buy cable, sockets, switches, and will pay for the labor. She offers her customers blankets, shoes and Amway products such as soap, detergent, shampoo, vitamins, nutrients for the body, creams, etc. She started this business 5 years ago. A friend invited her and recommended she go to a training. She paid for her order with a loan she acquired. She offers her products by walking door to door. Before this business, she sold food such as rice tacos, picaditas, dobladas and tlacoyos.  Her business is important because she has extra income. Since her business is going well, she sells well and her customers are her friends and teachers. She wants to grow her business by adding more products. She is planning on re-investing her earnings and taking out another loan. Her daughter Vanessa helps her with the business. She takes catalogues to school and sells to her teachers.  Her business is going to help her family to have more income. The improvements she wants to make on her home are putting in electricity, and fixing the floor and the bathroom. Her plans and hopes for the future is to have businesses and money so that her daughters can keep studying. This loan is going to help her be alright financially. Xochitl wants to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad that “I thank you for the loans you are giving me since it has a better interest rate."

loans.use: To buy Amway products, detergent, shampoo, blankets, shoes, cable, sockets, switches and labor to install electricity in her house.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: La señora Reyna Vázquez M., se encuentra localizada en Huitzililla, Cd. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 49 años de edad, estudio hasta el 2º. Año de primaria y después la termino en el INEA. Ella es soltera tiene 3 hijos Xochitl de 32 años de edad vive en unión libre, Maycot de 30 años de edad es soltero,  José Aurelio de 26 años de edad se fue a Estados Unidos a trabajar, ella tiene su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y solicito su crédito para comprar aceite, refrescos sopas, toallas, arroz, papel higiénico y productos de abarrotes para surtir su negocio, ella ofrece a sus clientes azúcar, jabón, aceite, queso, crema, salchicha, chorizo, tocino, arroz, frijol, huevo, alcohol, shampoo etc. Su tienda se llama Abarrotes la Perla, este negocio lo inicio hace 20 años por necesidades ella enviudo muy joven y sus hijos estaban muy chiquitos y de su negocio los fue criando, anteriormente ella vendía comida, su negocio es importante para tener ingresos , para ayudarse y tener una actividad para trabajar, a ella le gusta mucho preparar la comida todavía vende comida cuando llegan a trabajar al campo llegan de fuera y ella les da de comer a los trabajadores, ella está orgullosa con su negocio por que tiene dinero, porque tiene para todo, y que saco a sus hijos adelante, sus clientes son los vecinos, las familias, su negocio es popular por el buen trato al cliente y los atiende desde las 7:00 de la mañana, su negocio enfrenta la competencia de una tienda enseguida de la suya  y un puesto de verduras, ella atiende a sus clientes desde las 7:00  de la mañana, las ganancias del negocio las utiliza para volver a invertir, la señora Reyna quiere ampliar su negocio hacer su tienda como súper y lo piensa lograr trabajando y con lo que le den sus hijos, le ayudan en el negocio sus hijos  atendiendo a los clientes. Su negocio ha ayudado a su familia a que crecieran sus hijos, las mejorías que desea hacer a su vivienda son echarle colado a su casa y a su cocina cuando llueve hay goteras, sus esperanzas y sueños son tener dinero para su vejez y casarse, la señora Reyna esta muy contenta con este préstamo que le dieron sabe que tiene esta responsabilidad y va a pagar, las mejorías que dese para el futuro de sus hijos son dejarles un buen futuro económico y este préstamo le va a ayudar invirtiendo en el negocio y trabajando. La señora Reyna quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les doy las gracias porque nos dan buen apoyo y la confianza con este crédito para que mi negocio siga trabajado. Huitzililla es un pueblo tranquilo no hay delincuencia, hay campo, hay vegetación.
texts.en: Mrs. Reyna Vázquez M. lives in Huitzililla, Ayala city, in the state of Morelos, México. She is 49 years old and finished the second grade of primary school and later finished in INEA. She is single and has 3 children. Xochitl is 32 years old and in a common law marriage. Maycot is 30 eyars old and is single. José Aurelio is 26 years old and went to the United States to work. She has her own grocery store business and asked for the loan to buy oil, soft drinks, towels, rice, toilet paper and grocery products to supply her business. She offers her customers sugar, soap, oil, cheese, cream, sausages, chorizo, bacon, beans, eggs, alcohol, shampoo etc. Her store is called Abarrotes la Perla. She started this business 20 years ago out of neccesity. She was widowed very young and her children were very small. She raised them in her business. Previously, she sold food. Her business is important for her income. It helps her and gives a an activity to work at. She really likes to prepare food and still sells food when they come in from working in the fields. They workers arrive and she feeds them. She is proud of her business because she has money for everything she needs. She has been able to get her children ahead. Her customers are her neighbors and relatives. Her business is popular because of the good customer service. Her business faces competition from a store close to hers and a vegetable stand. She starts serving customers at 7:00 in the morning. She uses the earnings from her store to re-invest. Reyna wants to grow her store into a supermarket and she plans on doing it with work and what her children can give her. Her children help her in the business, serving customers. Her business has helped her family by helping her raise her children. The improvements she wants to make on her house are puting a roof on the house and the kitchen, since there are leaks when it rains. Her hopes and dreams are to have money for her old age and to marry. Reyna is very happy with the loan that was given to her. She knows she has the reponsibility and she is going to pay. The improvements she wants for her children's future are to give them a good financial future and this loan will help by investing it in the business and in work. Reyna wants to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad that “I thank you because you have given us good support and trust with this loan so that my business can keep on going. Huitzililla is a quiet town and there is no crime. There are fields and vegetation."

loans.use: To buy oil, soft drinks, soups, towels, rice, toilet paper, etc., to supply her business.

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es: José Alberto con su primer crédito, financiado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, inició el negocio que hoy tiene “El Caminante” , donde se dedica a la preparación y  venta de arroz de lisa, comida típica Barranquillera a base de la lisa, un pez de mar, que desova en aguas salobres, como las desembocaduras de los ríos; así mismo vende buñuelos, empanadas, deditos y otras delicias, que prepara con su esposa y transporta en su triciclo, el cual adquirió con su primer crédito con la Fundación, organización con la que ha logrado crecer y poco a poco provisionarse de vitrinas, calderos y de un tanque para refrescos, donde transporta el delicioso y típico arroz de lisa. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos en la comunidad donde habita y  donde tiene un mercado cautivo,  pues ahí mismo se encuentra  ubicada una estación de buses y de motos que son sus principales clientes.  José Alberto inició este negocio hace dos años , después de haber cambiado de actividad, ya que  antes se dedicaba a la fabricación y venta de calzado artesanal femenino, pero este negocio tenia un  proceso productivo  demorado y obtenía utilidades mínimas. Por eso cuando decidió vincularse a la Fundación,  aprovechó para cambiarse hacia algo que conocía y le resultaba mas rentable. Con los créditos ha logrado estabilizar su negocio   y  planea mas adelante comprar un enfriador para guardar especialmente el pescado y las carnes. Este, su Credikiva, es su tercer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él comprará materias primas e insumos como arroz, carne, queso,  maíz, harina y azúcar al por mayor. Sus indicadores financieros muestran una rotación de cuentas pro cobrar de 1 día, su rotación de materias primas es de 2 días y la rentabilidad es del 27 %. Con la nueva inversión planea ganarse descuentos por la compra en mayor cantidad antes de que los precios que inician a principio de año se hagan efectivos
texts.en:
With his first loan, provided by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, José Alberto started his current business called "El Caminante".  He makes and sells 'arroz de lisa' (a rice and fish dish).  This dish is a typical Barranquillera dish and is made with 'lisa', a sea fish which lays its eggs in brackish water such as river mouths.  José Alberto also sells 'buñuelos' (a type of fritter), empanadas (stuffed pastries), 'deditos' (cheese fingers) and other delicacies that he prepares together with his wife and then transports on his three-wheeled vehicle which he acquired with his first loan from our foundation.  Thanks to our organization, José Alberto has managed to grow in his business and gradually fill his display case, his cooking pots and his soft drinks cooler.

José Alberto's main customers are neighbors in his own community where he has a captive market as he is located in a bus and mototaxi station and this is where his main customers are found.  José Alberto started this business two years ago after changing his business activity.  He used to hand-make and sell ladies' footwear but that business had a long production process and he made minimal profits.  For this reason, when he decided to join our foundation, he took advantage of the situation and changed his business to something which he knew and which was profitable.  Through his loans, he has managed to stabilize his business and he plans, in the future, to buy a cooler in which to keep his fish and meat.

This Kiva loan is José Alberto's third loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy supplies such as rice, meat, cheese, flour and sugar wholesale.  His financial indicators show his accounts receivable turnover period at 1 day, his raw material turnover period at 2 days and his profits at 27%.  With this new investment, he plans to earn discounts by purchasing his supplies in larger quantities before new prices go into effect at the beginning of the year.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as rice, meat, cheese, corn, flour and sugar wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used shoes

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: La señora Luisa A. Avilés es originaria de Huitzililla, Cd. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México. Ella tiene 54 años de edad, estudio hasta el 2º. Año de primaria, ella tiene una hija se llama Rosa Isela tiene 16 años de edad está estudiando en bachilleres, ella tiene su negocio de venta de Jafra y Avon por catalogo y va a utilizar su crédito para comprar productos de Jafra y Avon lo que pida el cliente y para mejorar la casa para la alimentación, ella ofrece a sus clientes perfumes, viles, barnices, cosméticos etc. ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años la invito una amiga primero empezó con Avon   y después con Jafra ella va de casa en casa ofreciendo sus productos enseña sus catálogos y anota lo que quieren, ella lleva el pedido y le llega a su casa, al principio inicio con su propio dinero, ella tiene productos de sobra y los va vendiendo van sus clientas a su casa a traer para regalos, su negocio es importante porque se va sobrellevando en su hogar para la comida, los gastos y para pagar el préstamo , todo le gusta de su negocio más vender Jafra porque gana más le va bien le dan más ganancias, ella está orgullosa de su negocio cuando vende al contado. Sus clientas son las muchacaha, jobenes, señoras les ofrece perfumes, viles barniz, trastes de plástico, cosméticos, su negocio es popular por las ventas del Avon, los desafíos que enfrenta el negocio son hay veces que no tiene para pagar cuando su esposo tiene el le presta, la competencia que enfrenta son hay más personas que venden Avon y Jafra, las ganancias del negocio las utiliza para pagar los créditos, ella está planeando vender dobladitas, tacos de arroz y lo piensa lograr con el siguiente préstamo que le den, las mejorías que desea hacer a su vivienda son repellar los cuartos, pintarlos y echarle piso a la cocina, los planes y esperanza son salir adelante, mejorar su casa, tener una camioneta, ella está muy feliz con este préstamo porque le va a ayudar a su negocio y a su familia
texts.en:
Luisa A. Avilés is from Huitzililla, in the city of Ayala, state of Morelos, Mexico.  She is 54 years old, and she has a second grade education.  She has a 16 year old daughter, Rosa Isela, who is working on her high school diploma.  

She has a business selling Jafra and Avon by catalog.  She will use the loan to buy the Jafra and Avon products that her customers request.  She will also use it to improve the kitchen in her house.  She has been selling her customers perfumes, lipstick, nail polish, and cosmetics, etc. for three years.  A friend invited her.  First, she started with Avon.  Then she started selling Jafra.  She goes door to door to sell her products.  She shows her catalogs and marks down what they want.  She takes the order and later delivers it to the customer’s house.  She started with her own money.  She has extra products, and her customers go to her house to buy them as presents.  Her business is important because it is used to get food, pay expenses, and pay the loan.

She likes everything about her business.  She likes selling Jafra more because she earns more.  It is going well for her, and she gets good earnings.  She is proud of her business when she makes a sale for cash.  Her customers are girls, young women, and ladies.  She sells perfumes, lipstick, nail polish, plastic containers, and cosmetics.  Her business selling Avon is very popular.  The challenge she faces in her business is that sometimes she does not have the money to pay.  When her husband has it, he lends it to her.  She also faces a lot of competition selling Avon and Jafra.  She uses the income from her business to pay the loan.  She is planning on selling “dobladitas” (a type of Chilean bread) and rice tacos.  She plans to do that with the next loan that she is given.  

The improvements she wants to make on her house are to plaster the rooms, paint them, and to put down a floor in the kitchen.  Her plans and hopes are to get ahead, improve her house, and to have a truck.  She is very happy with this loan because it will help her business and her family.

loans.use: To buy Jafra and Aavon perfumes and lipsticks and to buy clothes to stock her business

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es:
José de 31 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposa y su hija de 9 años de edad, él es empleado de una asociación cooperativa de servicios eléctricos, tiene un año de estar desempeñando el cargo de notificador y motorista.
José en sus actividades debe caminar mucho para poder dar entrega a las notificaciones de los clientes, por lo se ve en la necesidad de comprar una motocicleta para poder realizar el trabajo fácilmente, para realizar esta compra él solicita un préstamo ya que no cuenta con fondos para hacer la adquisición de la motocicleta.
Su objetivo es que a través del préstamo pueda tener la motocicleta que seria una gran ayuda en el desarrollo de sus actividades laborales ya que así estará desempeñando una buena función y trabajando por proveer para su familia lo necesario  y ayudar a su hija en los estudios ya que su sueño es que sea una profesional de éxito.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old and resides in San Francisco Gotera, Department of Morazán, with his wife and nine year old daughter. He has been an employee of a electric utility cooperative for a year, working as a messenger and motorcycle driver.

As part of his job, José does a great deal of walking in order to deliver notifications to the customers. He needs to buy a motorcycle in order to perform his work more easily. For this reason, he is requesting a loan because he does not have the funds to acquire a motorcycle.

His goal with this loan is to have a motorcycle since it would be a great help in developing his work activities. This will allow him to function and work properly so that he can provide for his family’s needs and help his daughter with her studies since she dreams of becoming a successful professional.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Reina

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 50 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, donde vive con su hijo y su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de comida como pollo asado, hot dog, tortas mexicanas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en las afueras de una Universidad Migueleña, este negocio es rentable ya que los estudiantes universitarios siempre llegan a consumir sus alimentos.
Ella actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar productos y surtir el negocio su compra será en bebidas, carnes, pan, verduras y condimentos, este préstamo le ayudara ha prepararse ya que la Universidad comienza clases en este mes, lo que para ella es momento de ordenar sus productos y comenzar a realizar las ventas.
Su objetivo es que a través de su trabajo pueda ir mejorando su vida y las condiciones en general de su familia obteniendo mayores beneficios o ganancias.
texts.en:
María, who is 50 years old, resides in San Miguel, where she lives with her son and husband. She sells food such as grilled chicken, hot dogs, and sub sandwiches. Her business is located on the fringes of a university in San Miguel. This business is profitable because the university students always come to eat her food.

She now is requesting a loan to buy products and stock her business. Her purchases will consist of beverages, meats, bread, vegetables, and condiments. This loan will help her get ready since university classes begin this month, and for her, this is the time to buy her products and begin to make sales.

Her hope is that through her work she will able to keep improving her life and general conditions for her family by earning better revenues.

loans.use: Purchase beverages, meats, bread, vegetables, and condiments

loans.name: Morelia Group

texts.es:
María Miguelita Pérez Raimundo, vive en la Ribera Morelia, municipio de coapilla estado de Chiapas México, es soltera  y estudia la preparatoria abierta.
            
              El préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para su taller  de costura, como son: sierres, cortes, botones, hilo, entre otros,  en esta actividad lleva  ocho años desde que salió de la secundaria se dedica a esta actividad en que le va bien.

             Desde que tenía quince años ella practica este trabajo y aprendió por los cursos que dan en la secundaria que se llama corte y confección lo que gusto y  le da gracias a dios por haber aprendido ya que hoy es lo que lo saca de apuros en algunos gatos generados.

             De la ganancia de cada vestido u otra costura lo ahorra  para comprar mar materia y seguir trabajando con la costura que tanto le gusta  y asa poder pagar la colegiatura en la escuela.

              Lo que más desea es que logre terminar su preparatoria y seguir adelanté para tener su propio taller de donde pueda depender más adelante con su familia.

          Se integro al grupo por su mamá la señora Bertha quien formo el grupo y lleva el nombre de Morelia la razón del nombre  es porque  así se llama donde se integra el grupo.

      Las personas que integran el grupo son tres mujeres y son las siguientes:

     Bertha R. Pérez: invirtió el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, como son: azúcar, aceite, yogurt, entre otros.

    Norma Esperanza Vázquez Gómez: invirtió el préstamo en la compra  de materiales como son sierres, botones, hilos, entre otros para su taller de costura.

    María Miguelita pereza Raimundo: invirtió el préstamo en la compra de materiales para su taller de costura, donde elabora: vestidos, blusas, pantalones, entre otros.
texts.en:
María Miguelita Pérez Raimundo lives in Ribera Morelia, municipality of Coapilla, state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is single and goes to night school.

The loan she has requested will be used to purchase materials for her sewing business, such as zippers, scissors, buttons, thread, etc. She has been in this business for eight years since she finished high school. She does this business and it is going well.

Since she was 15 years old, she practiced sewing and learned it in classes through her high school, called tailoring and dressmaking. She like them, and she thanks God for having learned because now it gets her out of a lot of messes that come up.

She saves the profits she makes on each dress or item to buy more material and keep working as a seamstress because she likes it so much. This is how she is able to pay for her college classes.

She most wants to finish school and succeed in having her own seam shop where she will be able to help her family.

She became a part of this group by way of her mother, Bertha, who started the group and named it Morelia. The reason for this name is because that is the name of the place where the group started.

There are three women who make up the group. They are:

Bertha R. Pérez: She used this loan to purchase merchandise to stock her grocery store, such as sugar, oil, yogurt, etc.

Norma Esperanza Vázquez Gómez: She used this loan to buy materials such as zippers, buttons, thread, etc. for her sewing business.

María Miguelita P. Raimundo: She used the loan to buy materials for her seam shop where she makes dresses, blouses, slacks, etc.

loans.use: The purchase of materials to make clothes, such as dresses, blouses, and slacks. They will buy buttons, zippers, thread, etc.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela, de 67 años, es viuda, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su  tres hijos ya mayores. Desde que en vida fuera su esposo, durante 20 años, se dedicaban a la fabricación de muebles, en el taller de su casa. En la actualidad Marcela,  ha tomado el control y la administración de la  carpintería; por ser su única fuente de trabajo, que le ayuda con el sustento de su hogar. Por esta razón, su hijo también la apoya, ayudándola en la fabricación de estos muebles, de esa manera se gana la confianza de los clientes, quienes no dudan en hacerles más pedidos de puertas, mesas, sillas, marcos de ventas entre otros. Se siente muy contenta con su trabajo; por ello desea ampliar su taller. Es el 12avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, para acceder a posteriores créditos, pues quiere continuar progresando con su taller. De obtener el crédito que solicita, los invertirá en la compra de melamina, triplay y madera, para continuar desarrollando su trabajo.
texts.en:
Marcela is a 67 year old widow.  She lives in her own house with her three grown children.  For 20 years, when her husband was alive, they made furniture in the workshop at her house.

Marcela has currently taken over the control and administration of the carpentry shop.  It is her only source of work to help support her household.  That is why her son also supports her by helping her make the furniture.  This is the way she earns her customers’ trust.  Her customers do not hesitate to place more orders for doors, tables, chairs, and frames, among others.  She is very happy with her work, and she wishes to expand her workshop.

This is her 12th loan with MFP.  She pledges to make all of her payments on time in order to access future loans.  She wants to continue making progress with her workshop.  She will use the requested loan to buy melamine, plywood, and wood to continue carrying out her work.

loans.use: To buy melamine, plywood, and wood

loans.name: El Arbolito Group

texts.es:
La señora María Aida Vázquez Gómez, vive en la Ribera General Sandino, Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, es madre soltera con dos hijos  que está a su responsabilidad y son: Rodrigo Ignacio de trece años y  la más pequeña es Yuliana Montserrat de cinco años de edad.

        El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá para comprar mercancía y surtir su tienda de abarrotes  en    la cual  aun  inicio  hace  unos meses  y le está dando buen resultado cuando menos para sostener a sus dos hijos.

        Inicio por su propio merito ya que para trabajar sus pequeños ahorros tenía que emprender  una actividad de 
la cual  ella pueda salir adelante con su  familia que es muy importante para ella.
 
        De las ganancia que tiene lo invierte en la compra de mas mercancía  que le hacen falta en su pequeño negocio  así día con día se valla incrementado mas.

        De sea que su tiendita de abarrotes pueda ampliarse  y con ellos lograr todos sus sueño, como lograr ahorrar para comprar materiales y construir su casa que es lo que más desea tener.

       Su grupo se llama el arbolito, la razón del nombre es porque en frente de su casa hay un arbolito de ciprés. Formo parte del grupo por una invitación que le izo su prima la señora Guadalupe.

      Las personas que forman el grupo son  de  tres señoras y cada una  con su respectiva actividad:

     Guadalupe G. F.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de pollos por reja para luego venderlo en la misma región.

    María Aida Vázquez Gómez: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes comprando: azúcar, frijol, aceite, galletas, entre otros.

     Verónica del Carmen Z. Gómez: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de pollos por reja para luego venderlo aliñado  en la comunidad.
texts.en:
María Aida Vázquez Gómez lives in General Sandono, a riverside settlement in the Copainala municipality of the state of Chiapas, Mexico.  She is single, and she has two children she is responsible for.  Rodrigo Ignacio is 13 years old, and the younger child is 5 year old Yuliana Montserrat.

She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.  She just started it a few months ago.  It is giving her good results, at least with supporting her two children.  She started through her own merit.  To put her small savings to work, she had to undertake a business activity that would allow her to get her family ahead.  This is very important to her.

She uses the earnings that she gets to buy more merchandise that her small business needs.  That way, day by day, the business is increasing.  She wants to be able to expand her grocery store.  She wants to fulfill all of her dreams like saving to buy materials and building her house, which is what she most wishes to have.

Her group is called “Arbolito” (Little Tree) because there is a small cypress tree in front of her house.  She joined the group by invitation from her cousin, Guadalupe.

The group is comprised of three women.  Each one has their respective business activity.

Guadalupe G. F.: Will use the loan to buy live chickens which she will then sell in the area.

María Aida Vázquez Gómez: Will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.  She will buy sugar, beans, oil, cookies, and other things.

Verónica del Carmen Z. Gómez: Will use the loan to buy live chickens.  She will later sell dressed chicken in her community.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like sugar, beans, oil, rice, and other products to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed K. is 28, single, and has no children but has one dependent who lives with him; he helps Mohamed in his business in exchange for Mohamed's help educating him. In 2007, Mohamed established his electronics business where he sells radios, discs, tapes and lights. He began his business because he wanted a means to sustain himself. Working seven days a week, seven hours a day, he earns about Le 400,000 every month. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock for his shop. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to open another shop and buy land to build a house. He is serious and determined and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add more discs, radio, tapes etc.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
La señora Rebeca F. C. tiene la edad de 42 años, estudio hasta el segundo de secundaria y esta casada con el  señor Adan Casimiro con el cual tiene cinco hijos de los cuales cuatro son hombres de nombres Franco de 22 años, Adrian de 17 años que asiste a la preparatoria en temaxcal, Ruben de 12 años que asiste a la secundaria en la reforma y Rafael de 11 años que asiste a la primaria en la refomita y una mujer de nombre Ariana de 18 años que aiste a la universidad en Tierra Blanca. Doña Rebeca y su familia viven en la comunidad de la Reformita que pertenece al municipio de San Miguel Soyaltepec en el estado de Oaxaca.
Doña Rebeca nos platica que hace mas de dos años vende pollo destasado desde su hogar, ella nos platica que todos los dias saca una mesita a la parte de enfrente de su casa en la cual pone su venta de pollo y como sus clientes ya la conocen salen a comprarle sin tener que ofrecer, ella nos platica que decidio iniciar con su propio negocio ya que desea que ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos debido a que son muchos y el dinero que gana don Adan no alcanza, tambien nos platica que ella quiere abrir en su hogar una tiendita de abarrotes, con el tiempo y con su ganacias ir agrandandola construir su local y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de pollo, bolsas, frijol, arroz, sopa, jabon, azucar, sal, dulces, crema y queso para continuar con su venta de pollo y inicar con su venta de abarrotes ella desea que las ganancias sean buenas ya que desea darles estudios a sus hijos, tambien nos comenta que esta muy agradecida con la fundacion por la oportunidad que le esta otorgando de que su negocio prospere al darle este prestamo.
texts.en:
Rebeca F. C. is 42 years old and studied up to the second year of high school.  She is married to Adan Casimiro and they have five children: four sons and one daughter.  The boys are 22 year-old Franco, 17 year-old Adrian who attends senior high school in Temaxcal, 12 year-old Ruben who attends the local high school and 11 year-old Rafael who attends the local elementary school.  Their daughter, Ariana, is 18 years old and is attending university in Tierra Blanca.  Rebeca and her family live in La Reformita neighborhood, in the town of San Miguel Soyaltepec, in the State of Oaxaca.

Rebeca tells us that she has been selling cut-up chicken from her home for more than two years.  She tells us that every day she sets out a little table in front of her home where she places her chicken and, as her customers already know her, they come to buy from her without her having to go out and actively make sales.  She tells us that she decided to start her own business as she wanted to help her husband with their household expenses and  their children's education expenses as they have a lot of children and Adan's earnings didn't stretch far enough.  She also tells us that she would like to open a small grocery store in her home.  Over time, and with the profits that she makes, she would like to grow her business, build her premises and provide her children with a better quality of life.

Rebeca needs this loan to invest in buying chicken, bags, beans, rice, soup, soap, sugar, salt, candies, cream and cheese so that she can continue with her chicken sales and also start selling groceries.  She hopes that her profits will be good since she would like to provide her children with an education.  She also tells us that she is very grateful to the foundation for the opportunity that she is being given for her business to prosper through this loan.

loans.use: Chicken sales

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC WATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; ella tiene 57 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de panadería, la socia hace panes de diferentes formas, ella atiende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de panadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina, sal, y mantequilla para hacer los panes y pasteles.                    
        
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "SUMAC WATA" communal bank, which is located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.  

Her name is Elizabeth, and she is 57 years old. She is married with one child. Alongside her usual daily activities, she runs a bakery business: she makes different kinds of bread, and works in her bakery from 6am until 8pm. This work allows her to provide a future for her child. She would like to expand and improve her bakery business and is requesting the loan to buy raw materials such as flour, salt and butter for making breads and cakes.               
        
The member is very grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan in order to buy raw materials like flour, salt, and butter for making breads and cakes.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene, de 31 años, es una joven soltera, vive en su casa que es heredada, en compañía de dos hermanos, siendo el menor, soltero y el mayor con esposa e hijos. Desde pequeña acompañaba y apoyaba a su madre a vender  periódicos, en un puesto que posee, que se encuentra ubicada a una hora de su casa. Hace un año, desde que falleció su madre, ella tuvo que asumir y llevar adelante su negocio; desde entonces, trabaja todos los días, desde las 4 de la mañana, para poder adquirir los periódicos, para luego venderlas a partir de las 6 de la mañana. Le gusta el trabajo que realiza, puesto que siempre hay ventas, además a sus clientes asiduos le deja a crédito las revistas o ejemplares, y por ello tratan de ser puntuales en el pago cada fin de mes. Ante esto, desea ampliar su negocio con variedad de revistas, ya que su gran anhelo es el de instalar una bodega en su casa. Es el 12avo crédito con MFP, y sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para continuar ampliando su negocio, por ello se compromete en pagar a tiempo sus cuotas. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará revistas de colección de carros y de manualidades, por lo que le dejan mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Marlene, 31, is a single young woman.  She lives in an inherited house with her two brothers.  The younger one is single, and the older one has a wife and kids.  From the time she was young, Marlene accompanied her mother, helping her sell newspapers at her newsstand, which was located an hour from their house.  A year ago, when her mother passed away, Marlene had to take on the business and keep it going.  Since then she works every day from 4 in the morning, picking up the papers to sell starting at 6.  Marlene likes her work, since she's always making sales. In addition, she leaves her regular customers magazines and periodicals on credit, so they try to be on time with their payments at the end of every month. 

In light of her situation, Marlene wants to expand her business with a wider variety of magazines because her greatest dream is to open a grocery store in her house.  This will be her 12th loan with MFP, and she knows the support will really help her keep the business growing, so she is committed to making her payments on time.  Once she gets her loan, she will buy car-collector and handicrafts magazines, because those reap the biggest profits.

loans.use: To buy magazines to sell at her newsstand.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Sabino; el tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura y también se dedica a conducir una combi en servicio urbano en la ciudad de Cusco, el socio tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra papa, maíz y habas y luego lo vende en las diferentes ferias que existe, el socio quiere mejorar las tierras de cultivo. El  socio solicita el préstamo comprar semillas y fertilizantes para la tierras de cultivo.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sabino is a member of the community bank "Mujeres en Accion" [Women in Action], which is located in the Anta district in the province of Anta and department of Cusco.

Sabino is 38 years old, married, and has two children.  He balances his daily activities with an agriculture business.  He also drives a van around the city of Cusco.  Sabino has fields where he grows potatoes, corn, and beans and then sells them at different markets.  He would like to improve his fields. 

He is asking for this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his fields.  He is happy with this loan and he promises to make all of his payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Aouth Guenold

texts.fr:
A 22ans, outh est déjà bien fixé dans son métier de garnisseur. Célibataire sans enfant, il se lance dans la menuiserie après son  B.E.T. (brevet d’études techniques).
                         
L’argent du prêt passé, lui avait permis d’acheter un certain nombre de matériaux tel que : planches, colle, papier verre, pointes, éponge, tissus de garnissage, contre-plaquée.
Quand il  fabrique des petits meubles  utilisés par des ménagères, les tabourets, les pouffes, les tire –lire en planche, les bancs de cuisines et autres dépannage ; il a des recettes qui vont de 15.000F à 75.000F par jour ou par vente.

Avec le prochain prêt, il va plus se concentrer à son apprentissage des différents modèles des canapés et acheter des tissus luxueux pour réaliser cela.
texts.en:
At 22 years old, Outh is already well established as an upholsterer. He is single and has no children, and began his career after completing his BET (technical qualification). 

The money from a previous loan enabled him to purchase a range of materials, such as planks, glue, sandpaper, nails, a sponge, filing materials and plywood.  He makes small pieces of furniture used by carpenters, such as stools, pouffes, wooden stools, kitchen stools and other items; he takes in 15,000F to 75,000F per day or per item. 

With his next loan he is going to dedicate himself to his craft by making different styles of sofas, purchasing luxurious fabric to do this.

loans.use: Purchasing materials like plywood, nails, glue, sponge, velour material

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucila; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y entre otros, ella atiende desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda de abarrotes.


 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the community bank "Mujeres en Accion" [Women in Action], which is located in the Anta district in the province of Anta and department of Cusco.

Lucila is 37 years old, married, and has three children.  She balances her daily activities with working in her grocery store.  She sells necessities like rice, sugar, pasta, oil, and other items.  She works from 5:00am until 10:00pm.  

She would like to expand and improve her grocery store.  She is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise for her store.

She is happy with this loan and she promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 59 años, es una madre de familia muy  bondadosa y tímida, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo y sus dos hijos, estudiantes de grados universitarios. Por muchos años  Martha, tenía su bodega pequeña instalada en el interior de su casa, tiempo después cayó enferma sin embargo tenía que cubrir los gastos educativos de sus hijos, por lo que poco a poco, ya no tuvo capital para invertir que tuvo que cerrarlo. Es así que solo se dedicaba a su casa por un buen tiempo. Ahora se ha propuesto en reabrir su negocio, y así que está pintando los andamios que le quedaron, solo le falta capital para comprar los productos necesarios para la venta y que son de utilidad para los clientes. Espera que con esta nueva meta, poder cubrir la educación universitaria de sus hijos. Es el 12avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete una vez más de pagar puntualmente, y además manifiesta sentirse contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, porque todos los integrantes son muy solidarios. De obtener el crédito que solicita, los invertirá una parte en pagar la educación de su hijo y con la otra parte comprará gaseosas, para iniciar su anhelado negocio.
texts.en:
Martha, aged 59, is a very kind and timid mother of a family who lives in her own house together with her husband and their 2 children, both university students. For many years, Martha had her small restaurant installed inside her home.  Then she fell ill but, nevertheless, Martha had to pay her children's educational costs. Consequently, little by little, she lacked capital to invest and had to close the business.

As a result, for a good while, Martha could dedicate herself only to her home. Now she proposes to reopen her business and is painting the old location. She only lacks capital to buy necessary products to sell which may be useful to customers. Martha hopes that with this new goal, she will be able to cover the university education costs of her children.

This is her 12th loan with MFP and she promises once again to pay punctually. Also, Martha expresses her contentment with belonging to her communal bank, because all the members feel great solidarity. Upon receiving her loan, Martha will invest a part in paying for the education of her son and with the other part she will buy soft drinks and begin her desired business.

loans.use: TO COVER HER SON'S UNIVERSITY COSTS AND BUY PRODUCTS TO STOCK HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Espérence Augustine

texts.fr:
Femme de 46ans, célibataire, mère de 2 enfants,  coiffeuse depuis 2007. Son salon, situé dans sa zone d’habitation,Elle coiffe, maquille les femmes et les  jeunes filles de son quartier et les environs.

Le remboursement du prêt  n’as pas connu de défaut de payement grâce à ses ventes journalières qui  avoisinaient les 15.000F.

Avec le présent prêt, elle va plus améliorer les conditions de ventes en augmentant les articles de beautés comme : des  gros  pots de défrisant, 1 gros pot de gel a cheveux, 5litres de shampoing, 5litres de  démêlant, des gammes de produits de soins capillaire de grande marque, les filets, les produits pour maquillage et pour les grandes les  cérémonies. Les mèches et tissage de toutes marques.
 
Dans le souci de faire toujours mieux, elle veut agrandir son salon en ajoutant  les produits cosmétiques afin de faire plus de bénéfices et épargnes et enfin s’occuper convenablement de ses 2 filles.
texts.en:
This lady is a single 46 year-old mother of two, and has been a hairdresser since 2007.  From her salon, near her home, she offers makeovers for women and young girls in her quarter and its surroundings. 
She has repaid her previous loan thanks to her revenue that approaches 15,000 F per day. 
With the current loan, she wishes to improve her services by offering beauty products such as frizz serum, hair gel, five litres of shampoo, five litres of conditioner, a range of branded hair products, hairnets, makeup, and hair foils and weaves for special occasions. 
In order to continuously improve her service, she wishes to grow her salon by adding cosmetics to her product range; she hopes that in doing so she'll generate higher profits and will be able to put some money aside so she can look after her two daughters.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products such as conditioner, gel, face cream and manicure / pedicure products

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carlota; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos lacteos, ella vende quesos y leche en el mercado de Huancaro de la ciudad del Cusco, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos lácteos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos lácteos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carlota belongs to the “MUJERES EN ACCION” communal bank, which is located in Anta district, of Anta province, in the department of Cusco. 

She is 30 years old, has two children and lives with her partner. In addition to her normal daily chores, she has a business selling dairy products. She sells cheese and milk at the Huancaro market in the city of Cusco, working from 09:00 to 20:00. It is thanks to this business that she is able to provide for her children. Carlota wants to expand her business selling dairy products and has requested the loan to buy dairy products wholesale. 

Carlota is very pleased with the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy dairy products wholesale.

loans.name: Mireille

texts.fr:
Depuis 2ans  Mireille a ouvert son salon de coiffure devant sa parcelle, elle travaille à plein temps sauf quand elle repart faire ses taches domestiques. Mariée, mère de 3enfant en bas âges, elle coiffe, maquille, tresse et fait des soins esthétiques à ses clientes.

Le prêt passé lui a vraiment aidé car elle avait amélioré son salon et avait ajouté les produits de tout genre que les femmes utilisent souvent pour les soins capillaires.
Les mèches  et tissages qu’elle vendait ont aussi contribué  aux remboursements hebdomadaires de Hope.

Avec le prochain prêt, elle va renforcer son salon, améliorer les conditions et faire des prix de promotions.
Pendant les périodes des fêtes de : Tabaski, Ramadan, noël et les autres cérémonies, elle fait des recettes qui dépassent 60.000F par jour.
Dans le but de faire plus, elle compte ouvrir un institut de beauté pour sa progéniture.
texts.en:
Two years ago, Mireille opened a hair salon in front of her property. She works full time, unless there is housework to be done. She is married with three young children. She does her clients’ hair, makeup, braids and beauty treatments.

A previous loan was very helpful as it allowed her to improve her salon and offer a variety of products commonly used by women for hair care. She was also selling hair extensions and weaves, which helped with the weekly loan payments to Hope.

With the next loan, she plans to strengthen her business, improve her conditions and offer promotions. During the holiday periods of Tabaski, Ramadan, Christmas and other celebrations, she earns over 60,000 F per day.

She also plans to open a beauty school to benefit her children.

loans.use: To purchase hair and beauty products

loans.name: Meland

texts.fr:
Jeune homme de 26ans, célibataire avec son niveau universitaire qui se débrouille devant au coin de sa ruelle pour pallier à son état de chômage.

Il a un kiosque où il vend un peu de tout au passant et aux habitants de son secteur tels que : bonbons, biscuits, chips, stylos a bille, crayons, gomme, papier hygiéniques, mouchoirs à jeter, pains, beurre, …

Par jour, il vend 20.000F et 25.000F, il a remboursé le prêt passé et veut s’engager avec le deuxième prêt pour réaliser petit à petit son but :
- devenir homme d’affaire.
-   Faire des voyages afin d’importer certains produits rares sur son marché.
-   Fonder une famille.
-   Vivre dans les meilleures conditions.
Il compte acheter  pour ce prêt  1carton de biscuits de différentes marques, 1carton des savons en poudre,  des pots  de : (margarine, pâté, chocolat a tartines),  1carton de petites boites de lait concentré, des sachets de bonbons, des sachets de chips, du sucre, du sel . Il compte évoluer dans ce commerce jusqu'à ce qu'il atteigne son objectif, celui de devenir un homme d'affaire célèbre
texts.en:
This is a young, 26-year-old single man. He is unemployed despite having pursued university studies. He makes a living by selling miscellaneous items from a booth at the corner of his street. He sells candy, cookies, chips, ball pens, pencils, gum, toilet paper, paper tissues, bread, butter, etc. to passersby and local residents.

His daily income ranges from 20,000F to 25,000F. He has already repaid a previous loan, and plans to use this second loan to achieve his goals of becoming a businessman, traveling abroad to import products that are hard to find locally, starting a family, and improving his living conditions. 

With this loan, he plans to buy one carton of cookies of various brands, one carton of detergent soap, jars of margarine, pâté, and chocolate spread, one carton of small cans of condensed milk, bags of candy, bags of chips, sugar, and salt. He plans to continue with this activity until he achieves his goal of becoming a famous businessman.

loans.use: To stock up on cartons of milk, butter, sweets, soaps and detergents

loans.name: Adrienne

texts.fr:
Elle a une boutique d’habits  dans un grand marché de la place,  et devant celle-ci, elle a placée un étalage des bijoux fantaisies. Célibataire et  mère de 2enfants.                  

Elle avait utilisée l’argent du prêt pour acheter en gros les bijoux  fantaisies de toutes les marques .Ses ventes par jour étaient de 100.000F et elle a remboursée avec succès et ses épargnes ont augmentées à chaque remboursements

Avec le prochain prêt, elle veut renforcer sa boutique en ajoutant plus d’articles pour enfants de tous âges et ajouter un rayon  des tenues de cérémonies de mariage, baptêmes et accessoires de décorations.

A 48ans  résolue, elle a pour ambition de devenir importatrice du poisson salés et d’huile végétale et  soutenir la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This lady owns a clothes shop in a large market, and in the photograph above she has placed her jewellery stand in front of her. She is a single mother of two. 

She used her first loan to purchase costume jewellery by a variety of brands. Her daily turnover is around 100,000 F and she has successfully repaid her loans while putting some money aside too.  With her next loan she would like to boost her business by buying more children's clothes and adding a line of wedding and baptism suits and accessories. 

At 48 years old, her aim is to import salted fish and vegetable oil in order to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: boost her business by buying children's clothes

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina está feliz y no es para menos,  pues su hija pronto cursará el séptimo semestre de contaduría Pública en la universidad, gracias a los financiamientos recibidos por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y por Kiva; ella Sabe que es una inversión exitosa porque su hija, una excelente estudiante, aprueba cada semestre. Este es su  tercer credikiva y lo aplicará al pago de sus estudios y así será hasta que termine de estudiar, pues ya falta poco para ello.  Luz Marina dice a sus financiadores “muchas gracias y que sigan apoyando a las  microempresas Colombianas”. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Luz Marina S. ingrese a los siguientes enlaces: 
http:// kiva.org/lend/173039                             
y el 
http:// kiva.org/lend/221228
texts.en: Luz Marina is happy, and with good reason.  Her daughter will soon start her seventh semester in public accounting at the university, thanks to the financing from Fundación Santo Domingo and Kiva.  She knows it's a successful investment because her daughter, an excellent student, passes every semester.  This will be Luz Marina's third Kiva loan, and she'll use it to pay for college until her daughter is done, which won't be too long now.  Regarding the loans, Luz Marina says, "Thank you very much for continuing to support Colombian micro-businesses."  If you would like to find out about Luz Marina S.'s history, go to the following links:  http:// kiva.org/lend/173039 and http:// kiva.org/lend/221228.

loans.use: To pay for college.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
Don Carmelo, tiene 60 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 12 años de edad; su trabajo es la agricultura y ganadería trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 5:00am, tiene 35 años de dedicarse al negocio.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para mejorar la vivienda, este préstamo le ayudara a dar a su casa el mantenimiento necesario para que su familia se encuentre segura y cómoda, también los protegerá de las lluvias en tiempos de invierno. Para el su objetivo primordial es que su familia cuente con lo necesario para salir a delante, que su hijo pueda estudiar y ser un profesional.
texts.en:
Don Carmelo is 60 years old and lives with his wife and 12-year-old son in San Rafael Oriente, in the department of San Miguel. He works in agriculture, buying and selling livestock from 06:00 to 17:00. He has been involved in this business for 35 years. 

At present, he needs a loan to purchase building materials to improve his home. This loan will help him to make his house more safe and comfortable for his family. It will also ensure it is protected from rain during the winter. His primary concern is to provide everything that his family needs in order to progress in life. He wants his son to be able to study and to find a professional job.

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construccion (arena, cemento y hierro)

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Don José Antonio, tiene 60 años de edad, reside en Puerto el triunfo departamento de Usulután donde vive con sus nietos en casa propia, él se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos, este negocio tiene 5 años de existir, a don José le gusta mucho los quehaceres de la granja de cerdos, los cuales compra y vende muy a menudo.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar materiales para mejorar el corral donde tiene los cerdos, con esta inversión busca tenerlos en mejores condiciones, que estén de una forma más ordenada y segura.
Su objetivo es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, proveer de él ganancias abundantes y que su condición de comerciante mejore cada día.
texts.en:
José Antonio is 60 years old and lives in Puerto El Triunfo, in Usulután department.  He lives in his own home together with his grandchildren.  José Antonio's business is buying and selling pigs.  He has been in this business for 5 years and very much enjoys the work on his pig farm.  He buys and sells pigs very frequently.

José Antonio is currently requesting a loan so that he can buy materials to improve the pen where he keeps his pigs.  He hopes that this investment will allow him to keep his animals in better conditions, so that they are more organized and safer.  His goal is to continue strengthening his business, to make good profits from it and to improve as a salesman every day.

loans.use: To buy materials to improve his pig pen

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
el grupo Nuevo Amanecer esta integrado por 3 mujeres, viven en la colonia Nuevos Colorados y son mujeres luchadoras y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, a continuacion se detallan las actividades que ellas realizan:

la señora Lilian R. tiene 36 años de edad y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, vende su
producto en su misma comunidad y en varios lugares cercanos a su casa de habitacion.
todos los dias se levanta a las 4:30 de la mañana para empezar su produccion, tambien hace golosinas y las vende a los trabajadores de varias plantaciones cercanas.
Lilian trabaja muy fuerte para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, cal, leña y agua.


   Olga Marina M. tiene 26 años de edad y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, las distribuye a gran parte en la colonia donde vive y las demas las hace en las plantaciones de ocra ya que tambien tiene una buena clientela en ese lugar.
se levanta todos los dias a las 4 de la mañana para producir todos los pedidos de sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña y cal.

la joven Mirian S. tiene 25 años de edad, se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años, su producto lo distribuye en las a varios comedores de la ciudad de Choluteca, le hacen pedidos a diario.
 trabaja muy fuerte para sacar adelante a su hija.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, cal, leña y agua.
texts.en:
The "Nuevo Amanecer" group comprises three women, who live in the Nuevos Colorados neighbourhood. They are all very hardworking and determined to succeed.

Lilian R. is 36 years old. Her job involves making and selling tortillas, which she sells in her neighbourhood and other areas close to home. She gets up every day at 04:30 to begin making the tortillas. She also makes sweets, which she sells to workers at various nearby farms. Lilian works very hard to provide for her two children. She will use the loan to buy corn, mineral lime, wood and water. 

Olga Marina M. is 26 years old. Her job also involves making and selling tortillas, most of which she sells in her neighbourhood. She sells the remaining amount at the nearby okra farms, where she also has good customers. She gets up every day at 04:00, to prepare the orders requested by her clients. She will use the loan to buy corn, wood and mineral lime. 

Mirian S. is 25 years old. She too works making and selling tortillas. She has been involved in this business for three years. She sells her products to various restaurants in the city of Choluteca, which request her tortillas on a daily basis. She works very hard to provide for her daughter. She will similarly use the loan to purchase corn, mineral lime, wood and water.

loans.use: To purchase corn, mineral lime, wood, and water.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Cirilo; el tiene 56 años de edad y es casado y tiene 6 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cerdos, el socio tiene un lugar grande donde cría y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de cerdos. El  socio solicita el préstamo comprar animales como cerdos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “Women in Action" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Anta, which belongs to the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

His name is Cirilo; he is 56 years old and married, with 6 children. He divides his time between his daily activities and his business selling pigs. He has a large space where he raises the pigs, and later he sells them at various local markets. He would like to expand his pig-selling business. He is requesting the loan to buy animals such as pigs. 

The borrower is happy about the loan, and he is committed to making his payments on schedule.

loans.use: Buying animals such as pigs

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos lácteos y también se dedica a la venta de ganado vacuno, ella vende productos lácteos como leche, queso y mantequilla y el ganado vacuno lo vende en las diferentes ferias que existe, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos lácteos y ganado vacuno. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos lácteos y alimento para el ganado vacuno. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Women in Action" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Anta, which belongs to the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Nancy; she is 39 years old, with a live-in partner and 2 children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling dairy products, and she also sells cattle. She sells dairy products such as milk, cheese and butter, and she sells her cattle at various markets existing in the area. She is requesting the loan to buy dairy products as well as feed for her cattle. 

The borrower is happy about the loan, and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Buying dairy products and feed for her cattle

loans.name: Rocio Marisol

texts.es:
Rocio Marisol tiene 38 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Ella después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica a su negocio, ella confecciona ropa para niños, adultos y jóvenes. Roció Marisol requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por  ejemplo telas, botones, hilos y muchas cosas más. 
   
Rocio Marisol pertenece al banco comunal “Renovación” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.
texts.en:
Rocio Marisol is 38 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, Perú.  After completing her household activities, she works on her business.  She makes clothing for children, adults, and young people.  Rocio Marisol needs the loan to buy materials such as fabric, buttons, thread, and many other things.

Rocio Marisol belongs to the "Renovación" communal bank of the UMF Asociación Arariwa of Cusco, Perú.  The communal bank is made up of entrepreneurial and hard-working people who are always looking for opportunities to help their children get ahead.  Cusco is an enchanting city that goes back to the time of the Incas; the city is built on the base of the old Incan citadel.

loans.use: To buy materials such as fabric, buttons, thread, and many other things.

loans.name: Mario Andres

texts.es:
Mario Valdez un joven de 29 años residenciado en el barrio La Maria de Cartagena y estudiante universitario, decidió emprender su negocio de repostería, cuando se le dificultó pagar sus estudios y su entre los mismos  estudiantes  y tanta acogida tuvo su negocio,  que alcanzó a captar la atención de profesores y personal administrativo  como sus clientes principales, así es que cuando necesitan celebrar cumpleaños, días especiales como el del amor y de la amistad, o en temporadas festivas, siempre lo están buscando para comprarle sus mas deliciosos postres, como el  de las tres leches y es que  se ha posicionado  es este espacio educativo  y sus pedidos han crecido gradualmente.
Últimamente se le ha dificultado comprar en mayor cantidad porque no tiene un capital de trabajo muy grande y por eso se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para apalancarse.  Así que  este es su credikiva es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará materiales e insumos  como cremas, lácteos harinas, azúcar, uvas, frutas cristalizadas, fresas entre otros. Ahora su sueño es ampliar su negocio para tener puntos de ventas bien ubicados y con productos de la mejor calidad e higiene con la que él trabaja. Mario Vende a crédito y de contado y su mayor desafío es el manejo de los plazos que pide el cliente y los que él puede ofrecerles, con tal de recuperar su inversión lo más pronto posible para volver a surtirse y producir y de tener satisfecha a su clientela.
texts.en:
Mario Valdez is a young man, 29 years old, who lives in the community of La Maria de Cartagena. He is a university student who decided to start a bakery when he had trouble paying for his studies. It was among the students that he acquired such great attention to his business and later he attracted professors and administrative personnel as is primary clients. Whenever there is a birthday celebration, special occasions such as friendship day and Valentine's Day, or when it is the holiday season, he is always sought out for the delicious pastries he makes, especially one made with three different types of milk. He has found his place in this establishment and orders placed have been increasing gradually.

As of late he has had a difficult time buying in larger quantities because he doesn't have a substantial working capital. He has approached Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) for support.  This is his first Kiva loan and his first loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan he will purchase ingredients such as creams, milk products, flour, sugar, grapes, candied fruit, strawberries, etc. His dream is to expand his business and to have other points of sale strategically located, selling products of greater quality made in a cleaner working environment. Mario completes his sales on credit and in cash. His greatest challenge is managing the payments from the clients. The faster he is able to recover his investment he sooner he is able to supply his business and produce more pastries and keep his clientele satisfied.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients.

loans.name: Tayler

texts.es: Tayler tiene 37 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y amable, vive en compañía de su esposa y sus dos hijos varones, juntos se encuentran en una casa que le fue heredada por sus padres. A lo largo de toda su vida Tayler trabaja en la carpintería, fabricando muebles para el hogar como: camas, ropero, reposteros, mesas y sillas. Trabajo que es muy solicitado por sus vecinos, que gracias a la experiencia que tiene, han hecho que sus muebles tengan un buen acabo tanto en la pintura como  en el material en el que esta fabricado. Ante esto, su tiempo de trabajo es muy poco, siempre se mantiene ocupado, ya que espera terminar a tiempo los pedidos pendientes que tiene. Lleva 11 años en esta labor; por esta razón piensa tener capacitación en la fabricación de melamina, ya que son de mayor demanda en esta época. Es el 12avo crédito con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues desea obtener mejoras para su negocio. En su grupo comunal, es él líder y  muy responsable y siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de su grupo. De obtener el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de melamina en cantidades numerosas, para abastecer sus pedidos que tiene.
texts.en: Tayler is 37 years old, a very simple and loving man, and lives with his spouse and their adult male sons. They can be found all together in a home that was inherited from their parents. For the majority of his life, Tayler worked in carpentry, making furniture for homes such as beds, closets, pantries, tables and chairs. His work is in high demand from his neighbors and thanks to his experience, his furniture is well painted in addition to being produced from a high quality material. When there isn't much work going on, Tayler always keeps himself busy in the hopes of completing all of his orders on time. He has been working with carpentry for 11 years. Because of this reason, he plans to get trained in the production of melamine, a product in high demand during this time. This would be his twelfth loan with MFP and he promises to pay his payments on time because he wants to improve his business. In this communal group, he is the leader and is responsible and always worries about the well-being of his group. Upon obtaining the loan that he is requesting, he will invest it in selling melamine in numerous quantities in order to meet the orders he receives.

loans.use: To buy melamine.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia tiene 47 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Ella después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica a su negocio, ella se dedica a la elaboración de cuadros de pintura, ella pinta  paisajes, centros arqueológicos,  personas oriundas del lugar, y situaciones vivenciales del día a día. Amalia requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por  ejemplo pinturas, pinceles, telas y otras cosas más.     

Amalia pertenece al banco comunal “Renovación” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.
texts.en:
Amalia is 47 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. After doing her household chores she works in her business. She paints pictures of landscapes, archaeological sites, local native people and scenes of everyday life. Amalia needs the loan to buy materials such as paints, brushes, canvases and other things.

Amalia is a member of the "Renovación" ("Renewal") communal bank of the UMF Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco, Peru. The community bank is made up of female entrepreneurs and workers who seek opportunities that will help them raise their children. Cusco is a charming city dating back to Inca times, built on the ancient Inca citadel.

loans.use: Buy materials such as paints, brushes, canvases and other things.

loans.name: Jose Anibal

texts.es:
José, de treinta y cinco años de edad, reside en Usulután, junto a su esposa y dos hijos, residen en casa propia, él posee una tienda de granos básicos, su forma de vender es visitando colonias, barrios y cantones de la zona, a bordo de su vehículo prácticamente es una tienda móvil de granos básicos.

Por el momento necesita invertir en mercadería ya que se le ha agotado, por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra, esto le ayudara a tener una mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a los clientes, ya que en su mayoría vende productos como arroz, frijoles, maíz, café, sal, entre otros.

Para don José su propósito es siempre mantener el negocio activo, ofrecer a los clientes productos de calidad y no descuidarse de las zonas donde ya tiene clientela.
texts.en:
José is 35 years old and lives in Usulután with his wife and two children. They live in their own house. He has a store that sells staple grains. He sells them by visiting neighborhoods, districts and townships in the area aboard his vehicle; his business is basically a staple grains store on the move. 

At the moment he needs to invest in merchandise because he has run out of products. He is requesting a loan to make this purchase. This will help him have a greater variety of products to offer to his customers. He mostly sells products such as rice, beans, corn, coffee and salt, among others.

José's goals are to maintain an active business, provide quality products to his customers and not neglect the areas where he already has customers.

loans.use: Buy products.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Monica tiene 37 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Ella después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica a su trabajo, ella es asesora de una inmobiliaria y sus funciones hacer trámites documentarios, ella se encarga de asesorar a las personas que desean obtener casas en alquiler, también se dedica a la venta de casa y otras cosas más. Monica requiere el préstamo para uso personal y no quiso especificar para que exactamente es el uso del dinero. 

Monica pertenece al banco comunal “Renovación” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.
texts.en:
Monica is 37 and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. As well as doing her housework she works as a real estate consultant. Her responsibilities include doing paperwork; she advises people looking to rent a house. She also sells houses and other activities. Monica needs the loan for personal use and prefers not to specify exactly what the money would be for. 

Monica is a member of the "Renovación" ("Renewal") communal bank of the UMF Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco, Peru. The community bank is made up of female entrepreneurs and workers who seek opportunities that will help them raise their children. Cusco is a charming city dating back to Inca times, built on the ancient Inca citadel.

loans.use: For personal use.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 39 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Ella después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica a su trabajo, ella ha estudiado una carrera técnica y trabaja en una ONG cristiana. Celia requiere el préstamo y es para uso personal como por ejemplo para la alimentación de sus hijos.

Celia pertenece al banco comunal “Renovación” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
